metadata.content:
# Rim's Edge

Rim's Edge cantina


General information

Location
An outpost, Freerock, Expansion Region


[Source]

Rim's Edge was a cantina located in the pit of an abandoned monastery, which became an outpost, on a nameless planet eventually named Freerock. Four months after the Battle of Jakku in 5 ABY, the cantina was crawling with refugees of the battle, former members of the fallen Galactic Empire as well as pirates, explorers and fortune seekers. Nath Tensent, an ex-pilot of the New Republic, tracked down the ex-Imperial TIE fighter pilot Bansu Ro to Freerock and approached him at an alcove in the Rim's Edge, offering the man a place in his freelancing crew.

The cantina's signature drink, a Rim's Edge, was recorded in Strono "Cookie" Tuggs' Ultimate Cookbook.
metadata.title: Rim's Edge

metadata.content:
# Wanton Wellspring - Description[]

The Wanton Wellspring was a cantina located on the arid planet Rajtiri. Located in the city center of the city of Jibuto, the Wanton Wellspring was a hole-in-the-wall location. The Dressellian Has Obitt found the Wanton Wellspring was not a very unique location, thinking it was no more inspiring than the Contented Krayt on Tatooine, or no more nastier than the Malicious Moondog on Suba.

They served strong drinks, featured live music, including a Twi'lek band, and Obitt considered its wait staff to be attractive, particularly the Dressellian Woana. Gamorrean bouncers would work the door. The bartender was a four-armed humanoid. As a haven and headquarters for smugglers and rogues of all kinds, the Wanton Wellspring had a back room reserved for private groups that also served as a hidden area to stash illegal substances if the authorities inspected the premises. With many underground activities occurring there, the patrons of the Wellspring were a discreet bunch. The room could fit over a dozen people and had a ten-year-old holoprojector that could display maps and even entertainment holos.

During the Imperial Era, stormtroopers would respond to incidents at the cantina and detain any troublemakers. Local police previously did not interfere with many of the activities at the cantina, and the Imperial garrison nearby meant more secrecy was required. The Empire's presence disrupted the relationship between the cantina and local police, would warn the owners of the Wanton Wellspring about raids.
metadata.title: Wanton Wellspring

metadata.content:
# The Alcazar - Main area[]

The Alcazar was a cantina located in Myrra, the capital of Akiva, that was popular with the locals. The main area had an elevated stage for musicians to play and a long black bar carved out of dead lacquered driftwood. The bar only served a select few drinks including ale, grog and Starfire 'skee.

The Alcazar was also a gambling house that played host to games such as pazaak, Kessel Wheel and rolling sheg-knuckles and provided other services for those who preferred to play games such as the One-Armed Smuggler.

Aside from the main entrance, the cantina also had a side door which the locals named the 'shame door'. This was used for those who had consumed too much starfire 'skee, wanted to leave with a new friend or were ushered out by Surat Nuat's enforcers. The crime lord used the side door for this to avoid intimidating anyone from coming in and spending their credits there. Nuat always ensured the door was guarded and kept locked.

Upon locating the cantina for the first time, former Imperial Loyalty officer Sinjir Rath Velus surmised the venue was probably also a slaver market and black market compound.
metadata.title: The Alcazar

metadata.content:
# Unidentified bar (Nar Shaddaa) - History[]

Prior to the Invasion of Naboo, the Sith apprentice Darth Maul came to the bar and asked the bartender if he had information about the auction of a Jedi Padawan held by the crime lord Xev Xrexus and it's location. When the customers accused Maul of being a Jedi, Maul angrily engaged them in a bar fight.

Shortly after the Battle of Yavin, Luke Skywalker made a visit to the bar seeking safe passage to Coruscant. The bartender ignored his request and told his customers to kill him. However, Skywalker managed to defend himself with his lightsaber. The weapon piqued the Zabrak bartender's interest, and he decided to offer passage to Coruscant in exchange for the lightsaber. Skywalker declined his offer, prompting the bartender to once again order his customers to kill him and to also retrieve the lightsaber. Before they could, however, a thief inside the bar who worked for Grakkus the Hutt stole the lightsaber and escaped the establishment.

Responding to R2-D2's distress call, C-3PO and Chewbacca visited the bar, seeking information on Skywalker's whereabouts. The Zabrak bartender was uncooperative, telling the two that he did not welcome droids and Wookiees. C-3PO then challenged the bar patrons to a fight with Chewbacca. The Wookiee bested the bartender and his patrons, smashing at least one window in the process. The bartender then revealed that Skywalker had been captured by Grakkus the Hutt.
metadata.title: Unidentified bar (Nar Shaddaa)

A cantina was located on the planet Gerrenthum. Between 14 BBY and 9 BBY, The Grand Inquisitor visited the cantina in order to acquire information on the Jedi Knight Tensu Run, who was nearby. The Gamorrean bartender did not understand The Grand Inquisitor, but the inquisitor was able to learn the information from a patron, Pii-lor.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Gerrenthum)

metadata.content:
# Tanda's Cantina

Tanda's Cantina


General information

Location
Suria space station


[Source]

Tanda's Cantina was a cantina located at Suria space station. The bar was tended to by a modified pit droid and was a popular and bustling corner of the space station. Although neon signs gave the cantina a warm glow, the atmosphere could be hostile. Brawls and other incidents were common, and disputes were settled by fighting or blaster fire. It was a popular site for bounty hunters and other characters to frequent, with Imperial laws frequently being ignored in the name of business.

In around 18 BBY, Phee Genoa discovered that the bounty hunter Fennec Shand could be found at the cantina and alerted Hunter and Wrecker, who traveled to the cantina to get information from Shand.
metadata.title: Tanda's Cantina

metadata.content:
# The Alcazar

The Alcazar


General information

Location
Myrra, Akiva



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Surat Nuat's gang


[Source]

The Alcazar, or Alkazar, was a cantina located in the planet Akiva's capital Myrra that served as the headquarters for the Sullustan crime lord Surat Nuat's gang by 4 ABY. He imprisoned several of his foes including Jas Emari, Sinjir Rath Velus, and Temmin Wexley there. The Alcazar was damaged when the three prisoners escaped with the help of the modified B1-series battle droid Mister Bones.
metadata.title: The Alcazar

metadata.content:
# Unidentified cantina (Pijal)

Unidentified cantina (Pijal)


General information

Type
Cantina


Location
Pijal's capital city, Pijal


[Source]

A cantina was located in the capital city of the Inner Rim planet Pijal near the Pijali palace's stables. Two of the establishment's employees included the hostess Selbie and a Wookiee bartender. In 40 BBY, Lord Regent Rael Averross visited the cantina with his associates after riding a Pijal varactyl. When a Chagrian patron began vying for Selbie's attention, Averross gleefully brandished his lightsaber and embarrassed the customer until he left. Afterward, Averross saw a nearby holoscreen displaying the burning of a Czerka warehouse. He quickly left the establishment, believing that the incident was caused by the Opposition performance troupe.

The cantina was carved out of a dingy rock and had a muddy appearance. Due to this, some felt the establishment's smell was similar to that of the cantina's Wookiee bartender. During the Republic Era, the cantina served alcoholic beverages, and played music in a seating area equipped with a holoscreen.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Pijal)

metadata.content:
# Unidentified cantina (Level 1997)

Unidentified cantina (Level 1997)


General information

Location
Level 1997, Coruscant


[Source]


A brightly lit cantina was built on Level 1997 of the planet Coruscant. Shortly after the destruction of the planet Alderaan, the fugitive siblings Anandra and Santigo Milon met with a Pau'an criminal and his Herglic partner in the cantina. The group discussed the criminal employing and sheltering the siblings, but the Pau'an would not take on Santigo as he was too young, and so the fugitives refused the offer. A stormtrooper and a Coruscant underworld police officer then entered the cantina, causing the Milons to flee. The stormtrooper chased the siblings out of the building, and was followed by the Herglic.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Level 1997)

Docking Bay Drinks Cantina


General information

Mos Espa Podrace, Grand Arena, Vespaara



Chronological and political information

Hunters of the Outer Rim


[Source]


The Docking Bay Drinks Cantina was a location found towards the center of the Mos Espa Podrace battlefield of the Grand Arena, utilized by the Hunters of the Outer Rim on the planet Vespaara. It could be identified by a large horizontal sign with a raised brown. The background of this sign was dark blue, with an orange streak running along the top. Below was three lines of text, each in Aurebesh and differing in color. The top white line read "Docking Bay," the middle was light blue and said "Drinks," and the bottom in a big orange font displayed "Cantina," while to the far right of the sign was a neon illustration of a drinking glass filled with a bubbling liquid.
metadata.title: Docking Bay Drinks Cantina

categories: Alliance to Restore the Republic locations
metadata.content:
# Old Jho's Pit Stop - History[]

In 1 BBY, Jho was executed for attempting to help suspected members of a rebel cell. His bar was seized by the Empire, and given to Baron Valen Rudor, who converted the cantina into a place that was popular among Imperial personnel. While eluding Imperial forces, Ezra Bridger along with Sabine Wren visited Jho's former cantina only to learn about Jho's execution. Before Rudor could question the visitors, an old friend Jai Kell paid for their drinks and escorted them out of the bar, saving the two from being discovered. Kell had already joined Ryder Azadi's Lothal resistance group and led the Spectres to Ryder's rendezvous point.

Decades later, the diner's logo was used to decorate the flight suit and racing starfighter of Hype Fazon, a racer pilot on Colossus station.
metadata.title: Old Jho's Pit Stop

metadata.content:
# Unidentified cantina (Bardotta)

Unidentified cantina (Bardotta)

Cantina

Bardotta


[Source]


A cantina was located on the planet Bardotta. In 382 BBY, Axel Greylark traveled to the Outer Rim planets Eiram and E'ronoh to act as an envoy on behalf of his mother, the Galactic Republic Supreme Chancellor Kyong Greylark, during peace talks between the two worlds. During his journey, Greylark took a number of deviations from his charted route to the planets, including stopping off at the cantina. The envoy later noted that his droid, QN-1, had disapproved of each of the deviations Greylark had taken.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Bardotta)

metadata.content:
# BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits - Description[]

BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits was located on the Core Worlds planet Coruscant within Level 1313, which consisted of at least two floors. A droid was stationed at the entrance, inspecting the firearms of guests who entered the cantina, while another droid served as the cantina's bartender.
metadata.title: BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits

Oga's Cantina

Chronological and political information

[Source]

Oga's Cantina was a cantina found near Smuggler's Alley on Merchant Row, located in Black Spire Outpost on the Outer Rim planet Batuu. It was owned by a Blutopian bartender named Oga Garra, and pilot droid RX-24, now under the name "R-3X," worked as a DJ there. The bounty hunter Harkos was known to frequent the cantina. Unlike Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina, droids were allowed on premise despite there being a droid detector. Kendoh Voss once arrived at the cantina to meet up with a fortune teller she knew of, eventually meeting with Hondo Ohnaka of Ohnaka Transport Solutions.
metadata.title: Oga's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Ranjiy's Krayt Hut - Description[]

Ranjiy's Krayt Hut, also known simply as the Krayt Hut, was a makeshift cantina located aboard the New Republic flagship Lodestar. During the Galactic Civil War between the New Republic, a democratic republic founded by the Alliance to Restore the Republic, and Galactic Empire, the Krayt Hut was used by the crew of the Lodestar to gather after hours. The space was denoted by a glowing sign that displayed "Ranjiy's Krayt Hut" and included a couch that was worn down to its metal frame.

The Krayt Hut served drinks, mainly cheaper alcohol, as well as food, including military-grade imitation braised bantha. A bathroom was located somewhat nearby. The New Republic pilot Nath Tensent claimed the suite had once been the shipboard home of an Old Republic Senator from the planet Malastare and told his new companion and fellow pilot Wyl Lark of such. Ranjiy's Krayt Hut shared its name with the krayt dragon, a carnivorous reptilian creature.
metadata.title: Ranjiy's Krayt Hut

Cantina

[Source]

A cantina on the planet Brentaal IV served the pressurized Skakoan beverage known as the Skako Cooler. During a culinary tour of the galaxy that he took between 34 ABY and 35 ABY, the Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs intended to visit the Skakoan homeworld Skako to try their food, but abandoned that plan upon learning that he would need an atmospheric suit to survive the high-pressure methane atmosphere. Instead, he ordered the Skako Cooler from the cantina on Brentaal IV and mentioned the establishment as part of the recipe for the drink that he included in his third cookbook, The Ultimate Cookbook, which was published in 35 ABY.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Brentaal IV)

metadata.content:
# BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits - History[]

In 1 BBY, the cyborg bounty hunter Beilert Valance visited the cantina to drink. The bounty hunter Xonr later entered the cantina and found Valance drunk at a table. Xonr approached the cyborg and sat in front of him. After downing Valance's drink, Xonr threatened to kill him for breaking the Bounty Hunter Code.

As Xonr aimed a blaster at the cyborg from underneath the table, other bounty hunters around the cantina began preparing their weapons. A shootout ensued when Valance killed Xonr using his palm blaster. Valance, who in reality had allowed the hunters to follow him to the cantina, survived the encounter and eliminated all of them. Following the shootout, he paid the bartender droid for his next round and raised his glass, with the cantina patrons raising theirs in response. He then left the cantina and made his way to Docking Bay 21, where his starship, the Broken Wing, was parked.
metadata.title: BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits

BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits, also known simply as BG-RT's, was a cantina located within Level 1313 on the Core Worlds planet Coruscant. In 1 BBY, a shootout took place in the building between the cyborg Beilert Valance and several bounty hunters who had arrived to kill him.
metadata.title: BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits

Ranjiy's Krayt Hut, known simply as the Krayt Hut, was a makeshift cantina on the New Republic flagship Lodestar during the Galactic Civil War between the New Republic and the Galactic Empire. A gathering place for the ship's crew, it served food, alcohol, and provided a space for leisure time. The Krayt Hut was destroyed along with the entirety of the Lodestar during an Imperial attack in the Cerberon system in 5 ABY.
metadata.title: Ranjiy's Krayt Hut

metadata.content:
# Oga's Cantina - Description[]

Oga's Cantina was located on the Outer Rim planet of Batuu. It could be found near Smuggler's Alley on Merchant Row in the settlement of Black Spire Outpost. It was run by the Blutopian crime boss Oga Garra and was known for serving pilots, bounty hunters, smugglers, locals, and galactic travelers. These denizens used the establishment to conduct illegal business, meet a friend, confront an enemy, or just unwind. The cantina would eventually gain a reputation as a popular pit stop for those looking to avoid the eyes of the authorities. First Order stormtroopers were even known to occasionally pop in for a visit.

The cantina was a circular domed building that protruded from the side of one of Black Spire's many petrified trees.
metadata.title: Oga's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Losha Tarkon's cantina - History[]

Around 10 BBY, the bounty hunting crew of the Nautolan Nakano Lash visited the cantina for a briefing. While at the establishment, one of the crew's members—the Trandoshan Bossk—got into a fight with Houk patrons. At the same time, T'onga, another member of the crew, went to a bar to get a round of drinks for the group. She, however, became distracted by Tarkon and ignored two other bartenders' attempts to serve her. This resulted in it taking a long amount of time to acquire the drinks that her twin brother T'ongor went to see what had taken her so long, as he was in need of a Dark Blue Milk before Bossk got the crew kicked out of the cantina for fighting. When he realized the reason for the delay, T'ongor told his sister that he would have to get his own drink and returned to the crew's booth.

After T'ongor arrived back at the booth, Bossk, who had since stopped fighting with the Houks, attempted to bait the cyborg Beilert Valance into fighting him, though it failed as Lash held back the cyborg and told him to settle down. Immediately after, T'onga arrived at the booth, and the Nautolan began talking to the crew, telling them she saw them as her family. Lash then asked the crew to promise her that they would look out for each other after she had died so that even at their lowest points or in their worst moments, they would not be alone. With this, the Nautolan raised her drink in a toast, and T'onga clinked her beverage with Valance.

Between 3 ABY and 4 ABY, after returning to their home on the Moon of Logal Ri, T'onga informed Tarkon—now her wife—of her plans to open a cantina on the moon, and reminded Tarkon of the cantina she had owned. The two, along with their business partner Cadeliah then discussed ideas for what the cantina would have.
metadata.title: Losha Tarkon's cantina

A cantina was located in Vargo Spaceport on the planet Varkana and was owned by the human Losha Tarkon, who also worked there as a bartender. One beverage it sold was Dark Blue Milk. Around 10 BBY, the crew of the Nautolan bounty hunter Nakano Lash visited the cantina for a briefing.

While at the establishment, the crew member Bossk got into a fight with other patrons, and his fellow crew member T'onga visited the bar to buy a round of drinks for the team. Afterward, Lash spoke to the crew, expressing her hopes that the crew would look out for each other when she died.
metadata.title: Losha Tarkon's cantina

Unidentified cantina

28 ABY


Location
Sibensko complex, Sibensko


[Source]


During the New Republic era, the Sibensko complex housed a cantina that was popular with spacers and gangsters. In 28 ABY, the undercover New Republic senator Leia Organa and C-3PO managed to enter the cantina and access data from the local computer core. They managed to download banking records linking Rinnrivin Di's cartel to a paramilitary faction called the Amaxine warriors. The cantina was later destroyed along with the rest of the complex when an Amaxine starfighter crashed into the nearby Amaxine base's ammunitions depot during a brief dogfight; destroying the entire complex and killing everyone aboard.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Sibensko)

Taanti


[Source]


The Mos Pelgo saloon was a cantina located in Freetown, formerly known as Mos Pelgo, on the planet Tatooine. It was operated by the Weequay Taanti.

In 4 ABY, shortly after the Battle of Endor, the people from the city celebrated the destruction of the second Death Star at the cantina, when unexpectedly, the Mining Collective arrived and attacked the saloon.

In 9 ABY, the Mandalorian Din Djarin arrived at the cantina while he was looking for Marshal Cobb Vanth. Then Vanth entered, and while speaking with Djarin, ordered spotchka to drink. Shortly after, Djarin and Vanth held a meeting at the cantina with the population of Mos Pelgo to talk about a proposed partnership with a group of Tusken Raiders to defeat a krayt dragon.
metadata.title: Mos Pelgo saloon

The Zero Angle was the only cantina of the Galactic Empire's Bright Jewel Oversector Flight Base. While other flight bases had separate bars for groundhogs (atmospheric pilots) and vac-heads (space pilots), both groups gathered at the Zero Angle, which sometimes led to friction. Around the time of the Battle of Yavin, the bar was tended by Florn, a former pilot who had been injured in a crash.
metadata.title: Zero Angle

metadata.content:
# Unidentified tavern (Strop's End)

Unidentified tavern (Strop's End)


General information

Type
Tavern


Location
Strop's End, Teriona


[Source]

A dilapidated tavern was located in the Strop's End settlement on the planet Teriona during the High Republic Era. Between around 234 BBY and 232 BBY, the Jedi Master Loden Greatstorm and his Padawan, Bell Zettifar, visited the tavern while on their mission to the world. Greatstorm bought a round of vinbeer for the patrons and paid for the beverages by repairing the establishment's roof with Zettifar, as the tavern's bartender refused to accept Republic credits as payment. Later, the Terionese man Argeel expressed his gratitude for the repairs, and Zettifar later thought about the incident years later.
metadata.title: Unidentified tavern (Strop's End)

metadata.content:
# Unidentified tavern (Strop's End) - Description[]

The tavern was a small building in the planet Teriona's Strop's End settlement. It had a wide, sagging porch featuring several benches. By the time of the High Republic Era, the tavern had become dilapidated and had a hole in its roof until it was later repaired. The establishment also had a counter bartop.
metadata.title: Unidentified tavern (Strop's End)

Pamarthe

A cantina was located on Pamarthe during the days of the New Republic. The cantina sold a native Pamarthen drink, Port in a Storm. In 28 ABY, Greer Sonnel, a native Pamarthen, and Joph Seastriker traveled to this cantina where Seastriker was forced to drink Port in a Storm by the tavern-keeper. Sonnel instead drank it, proving herself to the tavern-keeper and other onlookers as being a true Pamarthen.

metadata.content:
# Losha Tarkon's cantina - Description[]

A cantina in Vargo Spaceport on the Outer Rim planet Varkana was owned by the human Losha Tarkon, who also worked there as a bartender. It featured gray exterior walls and a copper-colored Aurebesh sign over its front door that partially read "Losha." The establishment had tables for patrons to enjoy beverages—including at least one booth with a brown table and a lantern—and an area for servers to prepare drinks. Above the servers' area, a circular lighting fixture illuminated the room below in a blue hue. The cantina had gray walls featuring silver pillars and gold-colored decorative detailing running horizontally.
metadata.title: Losha Tarkon's cantina

metadata.content:
# 7-Gee Lounge - Behind the scenes[]

The 7-Gee Lounge appears in the 1999 video game Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace video game during the Mos Espa Arena level. However, the events of this level of the game somewhat contradict the ones depicted in the movie, as the bet against Sebulba happened inside the podrace hangar.

In the official strategy guide, it is referred to as "7-G Lounge".

Part of the music that is played in the 7-Gee Lounge is also heard in the Telos IV cantina in Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords.
metadata.title: 7-Gee Lounge

metadata.content:
# 7-Gee Lounge - Description[]

7-Gee Lounge was part of the Mos Espa Grand Arena complex, on Tatooine. It had a droid as a bartender, EV-7G7, who served juri juice and bantha blasters, among other drinks. EV-7G7 moved via a trench in the balcony, in order to provide a quicker service to its costumers. The cantina had a small stage which was set up for performers. In 32 BBY, the entertainers included two musicians: a Wookiee and an Ortolan who played a nalargon.
metadata.title: 7-Gee Lounge

# 79's

79's


General information

Location
Coruscant


[Source]

79's was a cantina located on the Galactic Republic's capital world of Coruscant. Offering alcoholic beverages, music, and several vidscreens for viewing sporting events, the bar was a bustling establishment popular with a segment of Coruscant's nightlife. Following the authorization of military leave for the clone troopers of the Republic's Grand Army, 79's became known for its frequent patronage by the clone soldiers during the later years of the galaxy-spanning Clone Wars.
metadata.title: 79's

metadata.content:
# 79's - Description[]

Located on the planet Coruscant, the capital world of the Galactic Republic, 79's was a cantina that operated in the ecumenopolis' entertainment district. At least two stories in height, 79's was nestled in one of Coruscant's enormous skyscrapers; the bar's main entrance was positioned at one of the building's corners, trimmed by wide walkways and supporting curbside traffic from speeders and air taxis. Two sets of sliding doors allowed customers entrance to 79's, above which the bar boasted a large, brightly lit sign displaying the establishment's name. Inside, an assortment of tables and booths were arranged for patrons to sit at across two floors. In the center of the first floor, a long, oval bar was tended by several 2-1B surgical droid droid servers, led by BU-11. They offered various drinks, served by several BD-3000 luxury droids as waitresses. 79's maintained a number of viewscreens broadcasting sporting events from around the galaxy, including podracing, and the bar played energetic dance music for its patrons. At the back of 79's main room, on the first floor, was as a latrine for customer use.
metadata.title: 79's

metadata.content:
# 79's - Republic Era[]

79's was a cantina located in the galactic capital of Coruscant. During the Clone Wars, the clone troopers of the Grand Army of the Republic would gather at 79's to party and blow off steam when off duty. 79's was known on Coruscant to be a clone bar; however, non-clones would also frequent it. ARC trooper Fives had taxi pilot Jay Igno take him to 79's where he met his friend Kix to ask for help after Fives discovered the Order 66 conspiracy. Fives fled the bar when the Coruscant Guard shock troopers arrived to search for him.
metadata.title: 79's

metadata.content:
# Wanton Wellspring - Description[]

The Wanton Wellspring was a cantina located on the arid planet Rajtiri. Located in the city center of the city of Jibuto, the Wanton Wellspring was a hole-in-the-wall location. The Dressellian Has Obitt found the Wanton Wellspring was not a very unique location, thinking it was no more inspiring than the Contented Krayt on Tatooine, or no more nastier than the Malicious Moondog on Suba.

They served strong drinks, featured live music, including a Twi'lek band, and Obitt considered its wait staff to be attractive, particularly the Dressellian Woana. Gamorrean bouncers would work the door. The bartender was a four-armed humanoid. As a haven and headquarters for smugglers and rogues of all kinds, the Wanton Wellspring had a back room reserved for private groups that also served as a hidden area to stash illegal substances if the authorities inspected the premises. With many underground activities occurring there, the patrons of the Wellspring were a discreet bunch. The room could fit over a dozen people and had a ten-year-old holoprojector that could display maps and even entertainment holos.

During the Imperial Era, stormtroopers would respond to incidents at the cantina and detain any troublemakers. Local police previously did not interfere with many of the activities at the cantina, and the Imperial garrison nearby meant more secrecy was required. The Empire's presence disrupted the relationship between the cantina and local police, would warn the owners of the Wanton Wellspring about raids.
metadata.title: Wanton Wellspring

metadata.content:
# Oga's Cantina - Description[]

Oga's Cantina was located on the Outer Rim planet of Batuu. It could be found near Smuggler's Alley on Merchant Row in the settlement of Black Spire Outpost. It was run by the Blutopian crime boss Oga Garra and was known for serving pilots, bounty hunters, smugglers, locals, and galactic travelers. These denizens used the establishment to conduct illegal business, meet a friend, confront an enemy, or just unwind. The cantina would eventually gain a reputation as a popular pit stop for those looking to avoid the eyes of the authorities. First Order stormtroopers were even known to occasionally pop in for a visit.

The cantina was a circular domed building that protruded from the side of one of Black Spire's many petrified trees.

metadata.content:
# Old Jho's Pit Stop - History[]

In 1 BBY, Jho was executed for attempting to help suspected members of a rebel cell. His bar was seized by the Empire, and given to Baron Valen Rudor, who converted the cantina into a place that was popular among Imperial personnel. While eluding Imperial forces, Ezra Bridger along with Sabine Wren visited Jho's former cantina only to learn about Jho's execution. Before Rudor could question the visitors, an old friend Jai Kell paid for their drinks and escorted them out of the bar, saving the two from being discovered. Kell had already joined Ryder Azadi's Lothal resistance group and led the Spectres to Ryder's rendezvous point.

Decades later, the diner's logo was used to decorate the flight suit and racing starfighter of Hype Fazon, a racer pilot on Colossus station.
metadata.title: Old Jho's Pit Stop

[Source]


A brightly lit cantina was built on Level 1997 of the planet Coruscant. Shortly after the destruction of the planet Alderaan, the fugitive siblings Anandra and Santigo Milon met with a Pau'an criminal and his Herglic partner in the cantina. The group discussed the criminal employing and sheltering the siblings, but the Pau'an would not take on Santigo as he was too young, and so the fugitives refused the offer. A stormtrooper and a Coruscant underworld police officer then entered the cantina, causing the Milons to flee. The stormtrooper chased the siblings out of the building, and was followed by the Herglic.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Level 1997)

metadata.content:
# Aunt Z's Tavern - Description[]

Newcomers or regulars, like Al and Jooks, could go there to eat, bet on the races, receive wise advice from Aunt Z, and of course enjoy a drink. The counter was often busy, but there were several other areas for patrons to hang about, including alcoves and a balcony that had a direct view of Doza Tower. Besides refreshment, foods, bets, and the occasional bar fight, patrons could also entertain themselves with music from a jukebox, two arcades, and a holo-dart target.

The place was decorated with all sort of oddities. Behind the counter was a collection of helmets, some of them Mandalorian, Imperial, rebel, or even from the old clone trooper pilot. There was also a reproduction of the decal that decorated the flanks of the Crumb Bomber, a gunship from the Clone Wars.
metadata.title: Aunt Z's Tavern

[Source]

A cantina was located in the capital city of the Inner Rim planet Pijal near the Pijali palace's stables. Two of the establishment's employees included the hostess Selbie and a Wookiee bartender. In 40 BBY, Lord Regent Rael Averross visited the cantina with his associates after riding a Pijal varactyl. When a Chagrian patron began vying for Selbie's attention, Averross gleefully brandished his lightsaber and embarrassed the customer until he left. Afterward, Averross saw a nearby holoscreen displaying the burning of a Czerka warehouse. He quickly left the establishment, believing that the incident was caused by the Opposition performance troupe.

The cantina was carved out of a dingy rock and had a muddy appearance. Due to this, some felt the establishment's smell was similar to that of the cantina's Wookiee bartender. During the Republic Era, the cantina served alcoholic beverages, and played music in a seating area equipped with a holoscreen.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Pijal)

metadata.content:
# BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits - History[]

In 1 BBY, the cyborg bounty hunter Beilert Valance visited the cantina to drink. The bounty hunter Xonr later entered the cantina and found Valance drunk at a table. Xonr approached the cyborg and sat in front of him. After downing Valance's drink, Xonr threatened to kill him for breaking the Bounty Hunter Code.

As Xonr aimed a blaster at the cyborg from underneath the table, other bounty hunters around the cantina began preparing their weapons. A shootout ensued when Valance killed Xonr using his palm blaster. Valance, who in reality had allowed the hunters to follow him to the cantina, survived the encounter and eliminated all of them. Following the shootout, he paid the bartender droid for his next round and raised his glass, with the cantina patrons raising theirs in response. He then left the cantina and made his way to Docking Bay 21, where his starship, the Broken Wing, was parked.
metadata.title: BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits

Oga's Cantina was a cantina found near Smuggler's Alley on Merchant Row, located in Black Spire Outpost on the Outer Rim planet Batuu. It was owned by a Blutopian bartender named Oga Garra, and pilot droid RX-24, now under the name "R-3X," worked as a DJ there. The bounty hunter Harkos was known to frequent the cantina. Unlike Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina, droids were allowed on premise despite there being a droid detector. Kendoh Voss once arrived at the cantina to meet up with a fortune teller she knew of, eventually meeting with Hondo Ohnaka of Ohnaka Transport Solutions.
metadata.title: Oga's Cantina

A cantina on the planet Brentaal IV served the pressurized Skakoan beverage known as the Skako Cooler. During a culinary tour of the galaxy that he took between 34 ABY and 35 ABY, the Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs intended to visit the Skakoan homeworld Skako to try their food, but abandoned that plan upon learning that he would need an atmospheric suit to survive the high-pressure methane atmosphere. Instead, he ordered the Skako Cooler from the cantina on Brentaal IV and mentioned the establishment as part of the recipe for the drink that he included in his third cookbook, The Ultimate Cookbook, which was published in 35 ABY.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Brentaal IV)

metadata.content:
# Oga's Cantina - Description[]

Oga's Cantina was located on the Outer Rim planet of Batuu. It could be found near Smuggler's Alley on Merchant Row in the settlement of Black Spire Outpost. It was run by the Blutopian crime boss Oga Garra and was known for serving pilots, bounty hunters, smugglers, locals, and galactic travelers. These denizens used the establishment to conduct illegal business, meet a friend, confront an enemy, or just unwind. The cantina would eventually gain a reputation as a popular pit stop for those looking to avoid the eyes of the authorities. First Order stormtroopers were even known to occasionally pop in for a visit.

The cantina was a circular domed building that protruded from the side of one of Black Spire's many petrified trees.
metadata.title: Oga's Cantina

metadata.content:
# 79's - Description[]

Located on the planet Coruscant, the capital world of the Galactic Republic, 79's was a cantina that operated in the ecumenopolis' entertainment district. At least two stories in height, 79's was nestled in one of Coruscant's enormous skyscrapers; the bar's main entrance was positioned at one of the building's corners, trimmed by wide walkways and supporting curbside traffic from speeders and air taxis. Two sets of sliding doors allowed customers entrance to 79's, above which the bar boasted a large, brightly lit sign displaying the establishment's name. Inside, an assortment of tables and booths were arranged for patrons to sit at across two floors. In the center of the first floor, a long, oval bar was tended by several 2-1B surgical droid droid servers, led by BU-11. They offered various drinks, served by several BD-3000 luxury droids as waitresses. 79's maintained a number of viewscreens broadcasting sporting events from around the galaxy, including podracing, and the bar played energetic dance music for its patrons. At the back of 79's main room, on the first floor, was as a latrine for customer use.
metadata.title: 79's

metadata.content:
# 79's - Republic Era[]

79's was a cantina located in the galactic capital of Coruscant. During the Clone Wars, the clone troopers of the Grand Army of the Republic would gather at 79's to party and blow off steam when off duty. 79's was known on Coruscant to be a clone bar; however, non-clones would also frequent it. ARC trooper Fives had taxi pilot Jay Igno take him to 79's where he met his friend Kix to ask for help after Fives discovered the Order 66 conspiracy. Fives fled the bar when the Coruscant Guard shock troopers arrived to search for him.
metadata.title: 79's

metadata.content:
# 7-Gee Lounge - Behind the scenes[]

The 7-Gee Lounge appears in the 1999 video game Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace video game during the Mos Espa Arena level. However, the events of this level of the game somewhat contradict the ones depicted in the movie, as the bet against Sebulba happened inside the podrace hangar.

In the official strategy guide, it is referred to as "7-G Lounge".

Part of the music that is played in the 7-Gee Lounge is also heard in the Telos IV cantina in Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords.
metadata.title: 7-Gee Lounge

The top white line read "Docking Bay," the middle was light blue and said "Drinks," and the bottom in a big orange font displayed "Cantina," while to the far right of the sign was a neon illustration of a drinking glass filled with a bubbling liquid.

EV-7G7 moved via a trench in the balcony, in order to provide a quicker service to its costumers. The cantina had a small stage which was set up for performers. Arcade Omicron was a cantina on the planet Bescane, situated in the city of Lumchugger's Hub. The entrance was a steeped archway topped with a flashing holosign, and the establishment was often packed with the tired workers of Galentro Heavy Works, who worked long hours in the planet's factories. The layout included a long hallway that was lined with several side rooms. A scaffolding stage was situated against one wall, set-up for local bands to provide music for the patrons. One such band that played in the Arcade Omicron was the Screaming Jawas. In the center of the main hallway was a holozoetroscope, one of the the only devices that existed outside of Coruscant. The side rooms were situated with scenic replicators which could transform the small rooms into a variety of different planetary locations.

During Operation Death-Hunter, a Rebel infiltration team formed by Colonel Dursa Conegan met up with two of its Rebel contacts, Cooper Dray and Lady Amber Comark in this cantina. The group was lead there by Lady Comark's astromech droid, R2-B4.

metadata.content:
# The Alcazar - Main area[]

The Alcazar was a cantina located in Myrra, the capital of Akiva, that was popular with the locals. The main area had an elevated stage for musicians to play and a long black bar carved out of dead lacquered driftwood. The bar only served a select few drinks including ale, grog and Starfire 'skee.

The Alcazar was also a gambling house that played host to games such as pazaak, Kessel Wheel and rolling sheg-knuckles and provided other services for those who preferred to play games such as the One-Armed Smuggler.

Aside from the main entrance, the cantina also had a side door which the locals named the 'shame door'. This was used for those who had consumed too much starfire 'skee, wanted to leave with a new friend or were ushered out by Surat Nuat's enforcers. The crime lord used the side door for this to avoid intimidating anyone from coming in and spending their credits there. Nuat always ensured the door was guarded and kept locked.

Upon locating the cantina for the first time, former Imperial Loyalty officer Sinjir Rath Velus surmised the venue was probably also a slaver market and black market compound.
metadata.title: The Alcazar

metadata.content:
# Ranjiy's Krayt Hut - Description[]

Ranjiy's Krayt Hut, also known simply as the Krayt Hut, was a makeshift cantina located aboard the New Republic flagship Lodestar. During the Galactic Civil War between the New Republic, a democratic republic founded by the Alliance to Restore the Republic, and Galactic Empire, the Krayt Hut was used by the crew of the Lodestar to gather after hours. The space was denoted by a glowing sign that displayed "Ranjiy's Krayt Hut" and included a couch that was worn down to its metal frame.

The Krayt Hut served drinks, mainly cheaper alcohol, as well as food, including military-grade imitation braised bantha. A bathroom was located somewhat nearby. The New Republic pilot Nath Tensent claimed the suite had once been the shipboard home of an Old Republic Senator from the planet Malastare and told his new companion and fellow pilot Wyl Lark of such. Ranjiy's Krayt Hut shared its name with the krayt dragon, a carnivorous reptilian creature.
metadata.title: Ranjiy's Krayt Hut

metadata.content:
# Unidentified bar (Nar Shaddaa) - History[]

Prior to the Invasion of Naboo, the Sith apprentice Darth Maul came to the bar and asked the bartender if he had information about the auction of a Jedi Padawan held by the crime lord Xev Xrexus and it's location. When the customers accused Maul of being a Jedi, Maul angrily engaged them in a bar fight.

Shortly after the Battle of Yavin, Luke Skywalker made a visit to the bar seeking safe passage to Coruscant. The bartender ignored his request and told his customers to kill him. However, Skywalker managed to defend himself with his lightsaber. The weapon piqued the Zabrak bartender's interest, and he decided to offer passage to Coruscant in exchange for the lightsaber. Skywalker declined his offer, prompting the bartender to once again order his customers to kill him and to also retrieve the lightsaber. Before they could, however, a thief inside the bar who worked for Grakkus the Hutt stole the lightsaber and escaped the establishment.

Responding to R2-D2's distress call, C-3PO and Chewbacca visited the bar, seeking information on Skywalker's whereabouts. The Zabrak bartender was uncooperative, telling the two that he did not welcome droids and Wookiees. C-3PO then challenged the bar patrons to a fight with Chewbacca. The Wookiee bested the bartender and his patrons, smashing at least one window in the process. The bartender then revealed that Skywalker had been captured by Grakkus the Hutt.
metadata.title: Unidentified bar (Nar Shaddaa)

metadata.content:

The Mos Pelgo saloon was a cantina located in Freetown, formerly known as Mos Pelgo, on the planet Tatooine. It was operated by the Weequay Taanti.

In 4 ABY, shortly after the Battle of Endor, the people from the city celebrated the destruction of the second Death Star at the cantina, when unexpectedly, the Mining Collective arrived and attacked the saloon.

In 9 ABY, the Mandalorian Din Djarin arrived at the cantina while he was looking for Marshal Cobb Vanth. Then Vanth entered, and while speaking with Djarin, ordered spotchka to drink. Shortly after, Djarin and Vanth held a meeting at the cantina with the population of Mos Pelgo to talk about a proposed partnership with a group of Tusken Raiders to defeat a krayt dragon.
metadata.title: Mos Pelgo saloon

Rim's Edge was a cantina located in the pit of an abandoned monastery, which became an outpost, on a nameless planet eventually named Freerock. Four months after the Battle of Jakku in 5 ABY, the cantina was crawling with refugees of the battle, former members of the fallen Galactic Empire as well as pirates, explorers and fortune seekers. Nath Tensent, an ex-pilot of the New Republic, tracked down the ex-Imperial TIE fighter pilot Bansu Ro to Freerock and approached him at an alcove in the Rim's Edge, offering the man a place in his freelancing crew.

The cantina's signature drink, a Rim's Edge, was recorded in Strono "Cookie" Tuggs' Ultimate Cookbook.

The White Door was a cantina situated in the port town Akmalla on a planet near to Hutt Space that operated during the waning years of the Galactic Republic. Shortly after the Battle of Naboo, the Duros gambler Kelna Toodo was tasked by the Hutt Beeda with eliminating a group of individuals who had meddled with Beeda's affairs, and Toodo planned to trick the individuals into gaining possession of the Barzo cargo freighter Radiant Splendor, on which he had placed a trap for them. To that end, Toodo approached the individuals inside The White Door and invited them to a midnight sabacc game in the cantina's back room. The game was attended by the Toodo, the meddlers, the Human Jokot, the Cerean Lar-Odo and Toodo's Twi'lek accomplice Lyt Re, and during the game, Re posed as the owner of the Spelendor and deliberately played badly, and she gambled away ownership of the Splendor to Toodo's targets.

In 13 ABY, the 3PO-series protocol droid C-3PO auditioned to perform music in the Codpiece so he could earn money to leave the planet with his counterpart, R2-D2. The assistant manager of the Wookiee's Codpiece compared his performance to that of a festering jizz-box and turned him away, saying that the cantina already had one of those in a corner.

Rik's Cantina


General information

Chronological and political information

Jool


[Source]

Rik's Cantina was a cantina in the Undercity of Coruscant, a frequent haunt of Cade Skywalker, Deliah Blue, and Jariah Syn around 137 ABY that appeared to be on the very planetary surface itself. It was owned by the Hutt, Queen Jool, who lived in a swamp below the cantina. Jool enforced a strict no-fighting rule within, and had a cybernetic eye, with which she could monitor the goings on throughout. The bartender was Finn, a no-nonsense being who would not hesitate to use deadly force to enforce the house rules. A common fixture at Rik's was the gambler Naxy Screeger.

Holoscreens transmitting podracing and live dancers entertained the clientele.

In 137 ABY, Cade stopped by the bar before his attempt to infiltrate the Temple of the Sith and leave Jool instructions in case he did not return: to hand over the access codes to the Mynock to Jariah and Deliah. Also expected Deliah and Jariah were Chak and Kee, who had rented their ship, the Grinning Liar to them. After seeing Cade, they hoped to intimidate him into revealing his crew's whereabouts, but failed.

The Nautolan Jak passed Cade as he entered the bar. He was the club's bouncer.
metadata.title: Rik's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Gusha's Luck - Behind the scenes[]

According to the glossary in Legacy (2006) 38, "gusha" means lucky in Huttese. This would mean that the bartender's name is "Lucky" (a possible reference to rabbits' feet being thought to be lucky) and that his cantina is named "Lucky's Luck."
metadata.title: Gusha's Luck

metadata.content:
# Losha Tarkon's cantina - History[]

Around 10 BBY, the bounty hunting crew of the Nautolan Nakano Lash visited the cantina for a briefing. While at the establishment, one of the crew's members—the Trandoshan Bossk—got into a fight with Houk patrons. At the same time, T'onga, another member of the crew, went to a bar to get a round of drinks for the group. She, however, became distracted by Tarkon and ignored two other bartenders' attempts to serve her. This resulted in it taking a long amount of time to acquire the drinks that her twin brother T'ongor went to see what had taken her so long, as he was in need of a Dark Blue Milk before Bossk got the crew kicked out of the cantina for fighting. When he realized the reason for the delay, T'ongor told his sister that he would have to get his own drink and returned to the crew's booth.

After T'ongor arrived back at the booth, Bossk, who had since stopped fighting with the Houks, attempted to bait the cyborg Beilert Valance into fighting him, though it failed as Lash held back the cyborg and told him to settle down. Immediately after, T'onga arrived at the booth, and the Nautolan began talking to the crew, telling them she saw them as her family. Lash then asked the crew to promise her that they would look out for each other after she had died so that even at their lowest points or in their worst moments, they would not be alone. With this, the Nautolan raised her drink in a toast, and T'onga clinked her beverage with Valance.

Between 3 ABY and 4 ABY, after returning to their home on the Moon of Logal Ri, T'onga informed Tarkon—now her wife—of her plans to open a cantina on the moon, and reminded Tarkon of the cantina she had owned. The two, along with their business partner Cadeliah then discussed ideas for what the cantina would have.
metadata.title: Losha Tarkon's cantina

metadata.content:
# Losha Tarkon's cantina - Description[]

A cantina in Vargo Spaceport on the Outer Rim planet Varkana was owned by the human Losha Tarkon, who also worked there as a bartender. It featured gray exterior walls and a copper-colored Aurebesh sign over its front door that partially read "Losha." The establishment had tables for patrons to enjoy beverages—including at least one booth with a brown table and a lantern—and an area for servers to prepare drinks. Above the servers' area, a circular lighting fixture illuminated the room below in a blue hue. The cantina had gray walls featuring silver pillars and gold-colored decorative detailing running horizontally.
metadata.title: Losha Tarkon's cantina

metadata.content:
# Fungus Pit - Description[]

The Fungus Pit was one of the most popular places to hang out in Bashka. It was owned and run by the Twi'lek Cheib'Kalla, and most of the staff were good-looking Twi'lek females, whom he had hired as a means of protecting them from slavers. He also employed three armored Besalisks, Dovoul, Jebbis and Gatwer, as bouncers and the Kubaz Fitre as a bartender.
metadata.title: Fungus Pit

metadata.content:
# Enceri cantina

Enceri cantina


General information

Location
Enceri, Mandalore



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Mandalorians


[Source]

A cantina was located in the town of Enceri, on the Outer Rim world of Mandalore. An old and worn establishment, the cantina's black-colored doors were the only parts of the building's exterior that appeared well-maintained by the time of the Clone Wars, a galactic conflict between the Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Inside, tables and chairs were spread about for patrons to sit at, and both food and drink could be ordered from the cantina's long bar. As Enceri was a small town, the cantina's patrons were largely well-acquainted regulars. The cantina was staffed by an elderly female bartender, and served mugs of black ne'tra gal ale, in addition to bowls of soup—either gi dumpling, or red gourd.

In the year 19 BBY, the Mandalorian couple Parja Bralor and Fi Skirata traveled to Enceri as part of the latter's rehabilitation from a head injury. After Bralor helped the wounded former clone commando navigate Enceri's streets, the two stopped in at the cantina for a meal and drinks. Skirata's attempts at ordering from the bar in Basic earned him odd looks from the elderly bartender—Enceri residents primarily spoke the Mandalorian language, Mando'a—until the older woman saw the sigils denoting disability on Skirata's Mandalorian armor, after which she spoke to him in a gentler and more helpful tone. Skirata ordered two mugs of ne'tra gal and two bowls of red gourd soup for Bralor and himself, and they enjoyed a table together in a corner of the cantina. Their time together was interrupted, however, by the arrival of fellow Mandalorian Fenn Shysa, who introduced himself to Skirata and attempted to enlist him in acting as Mand'alor in the interim until one could be truly chosen, a proposition he would later elaborate upon at a second meeting in the Oyu'baat tapcaf in Keldabe.
metadata.title: Enceri cantina

# Ravaging Wardog Cantina

The Ravaging Wardog Cantina was a run-down cantina in the decrpit part of Kig Dannen Spaceport on the planet Gellefon. It was in this cantina that a group of Rebels met with Watcher after ordering seven Green Galaxy drinks and putting an end to a barfight which was caused by Watcher. During that meeting, Borsk Fey'lya pushed his way into the cantina and joined Watcher and the group of rebels.

metadata.content:
# The Bonny Bounty

The Bonny Bounty was a drinking establishment located on the moon of Bogg 4. It was known as a haven for mercenaries and bounty hunters. The inside of the dimly lit cantina was furnished with long tables, guttering candles and a large fireplace. In 22 BBY, the young orphan Boba Fett met a thief named Aia just outside the Bonny Bounty. A Diollan and a Rodian patron remarked that pickpockets such as Aia were not welcome inside the cantina, but in truth the atmosphere of the Bounty catered to a wide variety of clientele.

metadata.content:
# Raging Rancor Cantina - Description and layout[]

The cantina had colored neon lights on its exterior. Inside, it was divided into various zones. There was a souvenir shop, where various Rancor-themed items, such as a Wind Up Rancor toys, could be purchased. There was also a gambling area, where the Rancor-themed games Rancor Hunter, Rancor's Maze, Rancor Wrestling and Ride the Raging Rancor could be played. At the bar, some Rancor-themed and strongly alcoholic drinks could be purchased, such as Rancor Blood and Rancor's Breath.
metadata.title: Raging Rancor Cantina

metadata.content:
# Raging Rancor Cantina - History[]

The Human Famier Denzmorren was the barman and part owner of the cantina, while the Wookiee Rrelbocco was its bouncer. In about 32 BBY, the Heroes of Cularin visited the cantina. While they were there, the wounded Sullustan Salld Nrump burst in and begged them to help him. Moments later, a group of mercenaries who were pursuing Nrump entered, beginning a firefight in the bar.
