Brogar's Cantina and Safe House, also known as simply Brogar's, was a combination of a cantina and safe house operated by Brogar on the planet Lok. He provided his patrons with security that included bouncers, Z95 patrol guard droids, and at least one Gotal door attendant; he always had a door attendant monitoring the electronic eye and entry intercom.

In 137 ABY, following the Sith–Imperial War, the Bothan Jedi Hosk Trey'lis sought sanctuary and transportation there at the same time as Naxy Screeger, who had a bounty placed on him by the pirate Rav. Cade Skywalker, Deliah Blue, and Jariah Syn tracked Screeger there to capture him and collect the bounty. In the process, they spotted Trey'lis, who also had a bounty that applied to any Jedi, dead or alive.
metadata.title: Brogar's Safe House and Cantina

metadata.content:
# Dirty Skiff

Dirty Skiff


General information

Location
Minboosa Tenement District, Nal Hutta


[Source]


The Dirty Skiff was a cantina located in the Minboosa Tenement District of the planet Nal Hutta during the Third Galactic War.
metadata.title: Dirty Skiff

metadata.content:
# Seko Cantina

The Seko Cantina was a cantina on the planet Ryloth.
metadata.title: Seko Cantina

metadata.content:
# Third Sun Cantina

Third Sun Cantina


General information

Location
Mos Taike, Tatooine


Builder(s)
D'Mayna Stallaphalat


[Source]

The Third Sun Cantina, also known as the Mos Taike Tavern, was a cantina run by the Bith D'Mayna Stallaphalat (aka Stella) in the town of Mos Taike on the planet Tatooine. Stella became a favorite with all the locals, and got to know everyone in the town, and they all came to her cantina. She even allowed Alliance to Restore the Republic operatives into her bar.

In 1 ABY, Jabba Desilijic Tiure took interst in her business, but she eventually convinced him to leave her alone.
metadata.title: Third Sun Cantina

metadata.content:
# Unidentified cantina (Narmle)

During the Galactic Civil War, a cantina was located in Narmle, a city on Rori, a moon of the planet Naboo.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Narmle)

metadata.content:
# Kedorzhan pub

Kedorzhan pub


General information

Type
Cantina


Location
Taris


[Source]

Sometime in 3964 BBY during the Mandalorian Wars, a Kedorzhan pub in the Lower City of the planet Taris was visited by Zayne Carrick and Marn Hierogryph when they were on the run from the First WatchCircle led by Zayne's Jedi Master, Lucien Draay. While Carrick was skeptical of hiding there, Hierogryph reassured him that the bar was mainly visited by Kedorzhans who had blurred vision for hours after working long shifts in the mines. Hierogryph then jokingly stated that they only had to worry if the news broadcasted smells on the transmitters.

The droids working there apparently mixed good drinks according to Hierogryph.
metadata.title: Kedorzhan pub

metadata.content:
# Woodoo Dunes

Woodoo Dunes


General information

Location
Mos Eisley, Tatooine


[Source]


The Woodoo Dunes was a run-down cantina on the east side of Mos Eisley. It was frequented by day-shift workers from the docking bays and low-life ruffians and spice peddlers. The doors were open all day and all night, offering little security for its denizens. At some point, the front window was broken when things inside got a little rough, and it was replaced with plain sand-worn alloy plating.
metadata.title: Woodoo Dunes

metadata.content:
# Smuggler's Rest (Ruusan) - History[]

One time around 5 ABY, on the eve of his dead daughter's birthday, Grif Grawley "celebrated" by burying his grief with Old Trusty until he fell unconscious. His wife Carole was summoned to and with the help of some locals, they loaded him on their skimmer to return home.

Six months later, Grif entered the cantina to meet Byron Devo III to warn him about an imminent Imperial invasion. To gain their attention, he blasted the sound system, and produced the ID plate of the Imperial droid PD 4786 which he destroyed earlier. His warning resulted to mixed response, high voices and commotion. Before leaving he said that he would be safely away from the settlement.

The cantina was probably ruined along with the rest of the Fort in the battle of Fort Nowhere.
metadata.title: Smuggler's Rest (Ruusan)

metadata.content:
# New Downtime

New Downtime


General information

Location
Folor


[Source]

New Downtime was a cantina on Folor that was used by New Republic pilots as a meeting place during a full retreat.
metadata.title: New Downtime

metadata.content:
# New Republic Cantina

The New Republic Cantina was located in the city of Algarine, capital of Algara II.
metadata.title: New Republic Cantina

metadata.content:
# Njinska's Tavern

Njinska's Tavern was a popular cantina located on Phyrstal Island in the resort city of Le Yer on the planet Abregado-rae. It was entirely made out of wood and its windows were very large and contained stained-glass art. It had a large T-shaped stage which featured many high quality acts and had a large wide bar along one wall. The stage had a trap door that led to a several meter long angled shaft which ran under the stage and to a back door. The tavern was serviced by three bartender droids and had two large Human bouncers for protection.

Brinaloy N'Vaari was a frequent performer at the tavern.
metadata.title: Njinska's Tavern

metadata.content:
# Guttersnipe

Guttersnipe


General information

Location
Hinder Island, Recopia


[Source]


The Guttersnipe was a spice parlor and cantina located on Hinder Island, Recopia. The Guttersnipe was frequented by slavers.
metadata.title: Guttersnipe

metadata.content:
# Unidentified Muunilinst cantina

Unidentified Muunilinst cantina


General information

Location
Pilaan, Muunilinst


[Source]

This Unidentified cantina was located outside the city of Pilaan on the planet Muunilinst. It had a poorly kept outside appearance with its transparisteel windows mud-spotted and colored brown.

In 0 ABY, a few months after the Battle of Yavin. Rebel Alliance members Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia Organa, Han Solo, Chewbacca, and X-7, the latter of whom the other Rebels were unaware was actually an Imperial assassin secretly using the alias Tobin Elad, went to the cantina to gather some information about their missing Rebel contact Mak Luunim.
metadata.title: Unidentified Muunilinst cantina

metadata.content:
# Smuggler's Rest (Ruusan) - Layout[]

Every night it was the busiest and loudest location on the planet, typically serving twenty people on its dozen tables of different shapes. A useless fuel tank was used as the bar. The walls were decorated with random memorabilia. It had a drink gong that sounded whenever someone bought a round of drinks.

As Ruusan was a "lost" planet far from the Galactic community, populated by colonists and spacers, the music heard in the Rest was off-fashion by a couple of years.
metadata.title: Smuggler's Rest (Ruusan)

metadata.content:
# Rik's Cantina

Rik's Cantina


General information

Type
Cantina


Location
Coruscant Underworld, Coruscant


[Source]

Rik's Cantina was an establishment located in the underworld of the ecumenopolis Coruscant.
metadata.title: Rik's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Kuzbar's Cantina

Kuzbar's Cantina was a cantina on Nar Shaddaa where Trandoshan drug dealer Minnix sold common drugs and tempest spice.
metadata.title: Kuzbar's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Tailfin Cantina

The Tailfin Cantina was a pub operating in the town of Bartyn's Landing, on the planet of Lamaredd, as of 29 BBY. It was the property of Jerrahg, who also served as bartender.

The Tailfin Cantina was a popular drinking point. It was enjoyed both by visitors to the town, as it was strategically placed, and also by lum-drinking sailors who enjoyed private gambling tables, all the while with an interpreter of kloo horn providing entertainment.

Fistfights happened occasionally with little provocation, with one of them taking place in 29 BBY because of a drunk seven-foot Quarren. The situation included breaking of furniture, although the musician still played The Hutt Two-Step all the time.
metadata.title: Tailfin Cantina

categories: Alliance to Restore the Republic locations
metadata.content:
# Cluster

Cluster


General information

Location
Nar Shaddaa


[Source]


The Cluster was a cantina on Nar Shaddaa that was a regular meeting place for criminals and spacers alike. It was one of the known hangouts of the Devaronian Vilmarh Grahrk.

During the Galactic Civil War, the Cluster served as a safe house for the Rebel Alliance
metadata.title: Cluster

metadata.content:
# Krayt Cantina

Krayt Cantina


General information

Location
Tatooine


[Source]


The Krayt Cantina was a cantina in Mos Eisley, Tatooine.

Kyle Katarn was familiar with the place, and, in 14 ABY, he went there to investigate leads on the Cult of Ragnos.
metadata.title: Krayt Cantina

metadata.content:
# Halin's

Halin's was a bar on Drall that Boba Fett had wanted to meet Goran Beviin there. However, the bar had closed in 35 ABY.
metadata.title: Halin's

metadata.content:
# The Maze

The Maze was a spacer bar located on a forested planet in the Mid Rim. It was in business during parts of the Galactic Civil War.
metadata.title: The Maze

metadata.content:
# Junction City cantina

Junction City cantina


General information

Location
Feriae Junction


[Source]


The Junction City cantina of Feriae Junction was a rough place where death was no great novelty.

However, in 0 ABY, Beilert Valance killed Marko Tyne so savagely even the normally desensitized regulars were shocked. Valance had been making a habit of capturing patrons with bounties on their heads, so much that it was impacting business.
metadata.title: Junction City cantina

metadata.content:
# Shorn Stabilizer

Shorn Stabilizer


General information

Location
Nubia



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Aarrom


[Source]


The Shorn Stabilizer was a cantina on the planet Nubia and owned by Aarrom, a male Ithorian, during the Galactic Civil War. It was known as the best neutral drinking-hole in the Corellian sector, a place where opposing factions could safely meet.
metadata.title: Shorn Stabilizer

metadata.content:
# Susco's Tavern

Susco's Tavern


General information

Location
Rhol Yan, Kalimahr


[Source]

Susco's Tavern was a tavern in the city of Rhol Yan on the planet Kalimahr. In 25,793 BBY, the Je'daii Ranger Lanoree Brock drank a local Kalimahr wine with Tre Sana in Susco's Tavern while investigating a group calling themselves the Stargazers.
metadata.title: Susco's Tavern

metadata.content:
# Smuggler's Rest (Ruusan)

The Smuggler's Rest was the local cantina in Fort Nowhere on Ruusan.
metadata.title: Smuggler's Rest (Ruusan)

metadata.content:
# Mos Espa Podracer Cantina

Podracer Cantina


General information

Location
Tatooine


[Source]


Some of its patrons referred to a cantina in Mos Espa as the Podracer Cantina. it was run by an Ithorian bartender and also boasted a large holoprojector stored exclusively with podracing information.
metadata.title: Mos Espa Podracer Cantina

metadata.content:
# Mynock Hole

The Mynock Hole was a cantina in Vlarnya on Courkrus. It was the hideout of the Blackstar Pirates, provided sabacc, and both male and female prostitutes in a restricted back area.
metadata.title: Mynock Hole

metadata.content:
# Medoric Fall cantina - History[]

The main customers of the Medoric Fall were off-duty members of the Thaereian military. A Bothan called Betrek Moy'nast worked in the cantina as a bartender and he would listen in on the Thaereians' conversations and send any information that he learned to the Cularin Militia. However, he was eventually arrested by the Thaereians and they had another Bothan work in the bar and pose as Moy'nast, in the hope that they might be able to identify more Militia agents. The Heroes of Cularin traveled to the bar to meet with Moy'nast, but soon realized that the bartender was not him and left.
metadata.title: Medoric Fall cantina

metadata.content:
# Stormview Lounge - Description[]

Many generations before the Galactic Empire, the Stormwiew Lounge was highly visited, with its transparisteel viewports granting a view of the Itani Nebula and its rolling gases and flashing ion and magnetic storms. But over the years the Lounge became forgotten, as was the space station itself. The viewports had been covered up by large metal sheets bolted around their edges, except two of them, which were still usable. There were just a few visitors left, so there was no need for more. A few tables littered the floor of the Lounge, and a bar was situated along another section of bulkhead.

The service was not as good as in other cantinas, and Gulek Lohn demanded many credits for the tasteless meals and watered-down drinks he served. Because Stormview Lounge was the only cantina in the station, however, spacers had no chance to get their meals elsewhere. Lohn knew about that, so the Rodian made full use of it.
metadata.title: Stormview Lounge

metadata.content:
# Power Dive

Power Dive


General information

Location
Ord Mantell


[Source]


The Power Dive was a cantina located on Ord Mantell.
metadata.title: Power Dive

metadata.content:
# Gorb Drig's cantina

Gorb Drig's cantina


General information

Location
Phorliss



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Gorb Drig


[Source]


This cantina was located on Phorliss and was owned by a Houk named Gorb Drig. Gorb Drig had intended to run this cantina together with his son, but his son had been killed in one of Houks' wars of conquest. In 4 ABY, soon after the Battle of Endor, Mara Jade was briefly working in this cantina as a waitress, being on the run from Ysanne Isard and her people.
metadata.title: Gorb Drig's cantina

metadata.content:
# The Smuggler's Rest

The Smuggler's Rest was a cantina in the Corellian Sector on Nar Shaddaa.
metadata.title: The Smuggler's Rest

metadata.content:
# Medoric Fall cantina

The Medoric Fall cantina was a cantina that was operated in Soboll on Cularin during the Clone Wars.
metadata.title: Medoric Fall cantina

metadata.content:
# Entertainment Module 081 Cantina

Entertainment Module 081 Cantina


General information

Constructed
After the Bombing of Telos IV


Location
Entertainment Module 081, Citadel Station, Telos IV


Builder(s)
Galactic Republic



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Telosian Restoration ProjectGalactic Republic


[Source]

The Entertainment Module 081 Cantina was located within Entertainment Module 081, which was a part of the massive Citadel Station that had been built in orbit above Telos IV in the wake of the Jedi Civil War. The cantina, according to the droid that tended its bar, served food and drinks from a wide variety of worlds, possessed a pazaak room, hosted a swoop track, and, as its centerpiece, a stage that was frequented by Bith musicians and Twi'lek dancers. During this time the patrons enjoyed the music, that several thousand years later would be played by a band in one of the cantinas of Tatooine.

During her stay on Citadel Station, the Jedi Exile, Meetra Surik, visited the cantina at least twice. While there, she freed the dancer Ramana from slavery, persuaded Luxa to let her into the Bumani Exchange Corporation (which was the front for the Exchange on Citadel), and convinced a Czerka Corporation employee, Corrun Falt, to unwittingly help the Ithorians in exposing Czerka's illegal actions in handling the Telosian Restoration Project.

Some time later, during the Battle of Telos IV, the cantina was placed on lockdown due to the attack on the station by the Sith Lord Darth Nihilus and his fleet.
metadata.title: Entertainment Module 081 Cantina

metadata.content:
# Unidentified spacer bar

A spacer bar was in operation on a planet and was frequented by Riggs Ashar of the planet's militia. Ashar used his position as a member of the militia to intimidate individuals at the bar.
metadata.title: Unidentified spacer bar

metadata.content:
# Chancellor's Head - History[]

During the time of the Clone Wars, the pub was used as a base of operations by the Lurid Gundarks, a criminal gang. When the Hutt Riboga retook control of crime on Genarius, the Gundarks refused to submit to him. He reacted by sending a group of his minions, under the command of Mok Cadrak, to attack the Gundarks in the Chancellor's Head. However, with the help of the heroes of Cularin, the Gundarks were able to defeat Cadrak.
metadata.title: Chancellor's Head

metadata.content:
# The Glow Spider

The Glow Spider was a cantina on Coruscant located on level 132, megablock 17, block 5, subblock 12. Nici "The Specialist" was known to frequent the establishment.
metadata.title: The Glow Spider

metadata.content:
# Crystalview Cantina

Crystalview Cantina


General information

Constructed
1 ABY


Location
Aurilia, Dathomir


[Source]


The Crystalview Cantina was an open-air cantina in the hidden township of Aurilia on the planet Dathomir during the Galactic Civil War. It was built after the reconstruction of the village, following the battle of Aurilia, in 1 ABY. Denizens of Aurilia often spent their time in the cantina. It also provided enough space for live entertainment.
metadata.title: Crystalview Cantina

metadata.content:
# Tyrena cantina - Description[]

The Tyrena cantina followed a floorplan extremely similar to other cantinas on several planets throughout the galaxy, which was most likely a prefabricated design. It had several alcoves surrounding a central bar, with a single bartender on duty at all times. The front and rear entrances were equipped with EPT-212 droid detectors and seating was plentiful.
metadata.title: Tyrena cantina

metadata.content:
# Unidentified cantina (Commenor)

Unidentified cantina (Commenor)


General information

Location
Commenor


[Source]


A cantina was located on the planet Commenor. In 0 BBY, a group of Rogue Squadron pilots—Wedge Antilles, Biggs Darklighter, Cesi Eirriss and Jek Tono Porkins—visited the cantina during a mission to obtain astromech droids for the Rebellion.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Commenor)

metadata.content:
# Wayfar Cantina - History[]

At least one bartender worked in this cantina. Among the beings who visited this cantina regularly after the Battle of Yavin were Jabba the Hutt's lieutenant Yondalla, the Twi'lek Stanic Wavingstar and Walda.

In 1 ABY, a spacer recruited by one of the minions of Jabba the Hutt, the Trandoshan bounty hunter Bossk, rescued Stanic Wavingstar, one of Jabba's informants, from a Black Sun assassin in front of the cantina.
metadata.title: Wayfar Cantina

metadata.content:
# Wayfar Cantina - Description[]

The cantina was the largest building and the center of the small town. It had two entrances, one in the front and one in the back. The cantina consisted of a large room with a long, U-shaped bar counter in the middle of the room where a bartender sold beverages. Six large booths along the walls provided tables and chairs where people could sit down, drink and listen to the music. A door behind the bar led to a small back room that wasn't in use as of 1 ABY. In another room in the back of the cantina, several gambling machines were installed, including Lugjack and Jubilee Wheel.

Among the beverages available at the bar were Bantha Blood Fizz, Ardees, Tatooine Sunburn, Lopez Softdrink, milk and imported Utozz.
metadata.title: Wayfar Cantina

metadata.content:
# Wayfar Cantina

Wayfar cantina


General information

Location
Wayfar, Tatooine


[Source]


The Wayfar Cantina was a popular establishment in the small desert town of Wayfar on the planet Tatooine.
metadata.title: Wayfar Cantina

metadata.content:
# Slugfall Cantina

Slugfall Cantina


General information

Location
Slugfall Harbor, Mek-Sha


[Source]

Slugfall Cantina was a cantina at Slugfall Harbor, within the space station Mek-Sha in 3627 BBY.
metadata.title: Slugfall Cantina

metadata.content:
# Chancellor's Head

The Chancellor's Head was a pub located in the city of Tolea Biqua, on the planet Genarius.
metadata.title: Chancellor's Head

metadata.content:
# Entertainment Module 081 Cantina - Behind the scenes[]

The music played in Entertainment Module 081 Cantina is the same one that can be originally heard in 7-Gee Lounge from the video game adaptation of Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace.
metadata.title: Entertainment Module 081 Cantina

metadata.content:
# Ooze

Ooze


General information

Location
Nal Hutta


[Source]

Ooze was a cantina on the planet Nal Hutta during the Galactic Civil War.
metadata.title: Ooze

metadata.content:
# Happy Landing - Description[]

Happy Landing was two stories high and was situated just outside the Tazan starport's main gate. Inside, the cantina had many small rooms and it also had a balcony that offered panoramic views of Tazan City. The cantina's clientele consisted primarily of Human locals and spacers of various species.
metadata.title: Happy Landing

metadata.content:
# Emthuul's

Emthuul's was a large bar that was located on the planet Byrsym and operated by the Gloorag Emthuul. During the early years of the Galactic Empire, a group of individuals from the planet Daimar traveled to the bar, to speak with the Toydarian merchant Ballon.
metadata.title: Emthuul's

metadata.content:
# Wayfar Cantina - Behind the scenes[]

This cantina is a location in Sony Online Entertainment's MMORPG Star Wars Galaxies. The developers used the building model that was also used for most other cantinas in the game. Like all cantinas in the game, it features a bartender that sells a small selection of drinks as well as various Non-Player Characters (NPCs) of random gender, appearance and profession. There are also three NPCs that offer small quests or are involved in other quests.

The cantina also provides a place for players of the entertainer profession to perform their music and dancing acts and give out buffs.
metadata.title: Wayfar Cantina

metadata.content:
# Snapping Septoid

Snapping Septoid


General information

Location
Uscru Entertainment District, Galactic City, Coruscant


[Source]


The Snapping Septoid was a cantina in the Uscru Entertainment District of Galactic City on Coruscant, in operation during the time of the Separatist Crisis. It was located next door to the Outlander Club.
metadata.title: Snapping Septoid

metadata.content:
# Sleeping Rancor

Sleeping Rancor


General information

Location
Nuba City, Nubia



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Duff Caros


[Source]


The Sleeping Rancor was a cantina in Nuba City on the planet Nubia and owned by Duff Caros, a male Human cyborg, during the Galactic Civil War.
metadata.title: Sleeping Rancor

metadata.content:
# Starboard Broadside Club

Starboard Broadside Club


General information

Locations
Omze's Incredible Traveling Starport



Operational information

Owners
Broadside


[Source]

The Starboard Broadside Club was a cantina aboard Omze's Incredible Traveling Starport. It was owned by the Wookiee Broadside. It was lit by the large viewports that took in the ambient light created by orbiting a sun or planet. The club was staffed by Twi'lek serving girls who provided drinks and hearty meals to the clientele.

The club was outfitted with luxurious leather-covered chairs, shiny metal fixtures, and sparkling glassware. A small stage was in the back, where a band often played music for the patrons. The club also had gaming tables for entertainment.
metadata.title: Starboard Broadside Club

metadata.content:
# Stormview Lounge

The Stormview Lounge was,by the time of the Galactic Civil War, the only eating establishment on Darknon Station. It was run by a grumpy Rodian named Gulek Lohn. The cantina was situated along one edge at the end of the Concourse and was also used by its owner to spy on visitors. Any overheard information about a possible bounty that might be on an individual, Lohn sold to bounty hunters.
metadata.title: Stormview Lounge

metadata.content:
# Event Horizon (Seikosha)

The Event Horizon was a cantina in Cairn on the planet Seikosha.
metadata.title: Event Horizon (Seikosha)

metadata.content:
# Twilight Taverna

Twlight Taverna


General information

Location
Ploughtekal Market, Coruscant


[Source]

Twilight Taverna was a cantina that was located just off Ploughtekal Market, a multi-level market situated within the Zi-Kree Sector of the planet Coruscant. The cantina was in operation during the early years of the Galactic Empire.
metadata.title: Twilight Taverna

metadata.content:
# The Undertow

The Undertow


General information

Location
Nar Shaddaa


[Source]

The Undertow was a seedy bar owned by a Whiphid on Nar Shaddaa. Criminals and thugs went to the Undertow when they want to avoid Imperials. Galen Marek went there to find Rahm Kota as part of Darth Vader's fake plot to overthrow Emperor Palpatine. When Marek threatened the owner about whether they knew where Kota was, the patrons started attacking the Dark Jedi, since due to the Great Jedi Purge, any Jedi they found would be placed with a bounty for the Empire. After finishing off the bounty hunters, Imperial Navy commandos arrived and after killing them, Galen fought an Emperor's Shadow Guard and a squad of Shadow Troopers.
metadata.title: The Undertow

metadata.content:
# Zana's tavern

Zana's Tavern was a cantina on the planet Belderone. It was run by Zana, an older woman who had once had a relationship with a Jedi Knight, Flint Torul. Locals would stop by the place to have a drink before their shifts at the factory, and Zana was happy to accommodate them. Around 3 ABY, the Rebel heroes, Luke Skywalker, Lando Calrissian, Chewbacca, and Leia Organa came to the tavern to try to discover clues about what the Imperials were doing on Belderone. During their stay, they were attacked by assassins sent by General Andrid, but they were able to fend them off.

During the Battle of Belderone, an Imperial AT-AT broke loose from the battle, and rampaged through the city. The tavern was completely obliterated, and Zana was killed. Her son, Flint would discover her lifeless body among the wreckage of the tavern the next morning.
metadata.title: Zana's tavern

metadata.content:
# The Desperate Pilot

The Desperate Pilot was a cantina on Naos III. It was presumably owned by the Naos III Mercantile.
metadata.title: The Desperate Pilot

metadata.content:
# Landing Lights Bar

The Landing Lights Bar was a cantina, that was located in the city Hedrett, on the planet Cularin. It operated during the waning years of the Galactic Republic.
metadata.title: Landing Lights Bar

metadata.content:
# Happy Landing

Happy Landing


General information

Location
Tazan City, Tazan


[Source]

Happy Landing was the main cantina of the Tazan starport, on the planet Tazan.
metadata.title: Happy Landing

Tyrena cantina


General information

Tyrena, Corellia



Chronological and political information

Alliance to Restore the RepublicShalera the Hutt

The Tyrena cantina was a cantina in the city of Tyrena on the planet Corellia.
metadata.title: Tyrena cantina

metadata.content:
# Landing Lights Bar - Description[]

The bar was located in the city of Hedrett, near to Hedrett Groundport. It was a long, low building, that was made of duracrete. Outside, it had a large parking lot and a pale blue neon sign with the bar's name on. The cantina was the site of a lot of gambling and brawls among the patrons were also not uncommon. The bar had patrons from among a wide variety of species and most of them were workers at Hedrett Groundport.
metadata.title: Landing Lights Bar

metadata.content:
# Glaggerick's Tavern

Glaggerick's Tavern was a small cantina located on the planet Lianna.
metadata.title: Glaggerick's Tavern

metadata.content:
# Stormview Lounge - Description[]

Many generations before the Galactic Empire, the Stormwiew Lounge was highly visited, with its transparisteel viewports granting a view of the Itani Nebula and its rolling gases and flashing ion and magnetic storms. But over the years the Lounge became forgotten, as was the space station itself. The viewports had been covered up by large metal sheets bolted around their edges, except two of them, which were still usable. There were just a few visitors left, so there was no need for more. A few tables littered the floor of the Lounge, and a bar was situated along another section of bulkhead.

The service was not as good as in other cantinas, and Gulek Lohn demanded many credits for the tasteless meals and watered-down drinks he served. Because Stormview Lounge was the only cantina in the station, however, spacers had no chance to get their meals elsewhere. Lohn knew about that, so the Rodian made full use of it.
metadata.title: Stormview Lounge

metadata.content:
# Cruelest Cut

The Cruelest Cut was one of the most notorious cantinas in Point Nadir. It was located in the Nest. It catered to thugs, assassins, fighters and mercenaries. It was owned by a Hutt named Yuelo.

It ran gladiatorial events and live blood sports. Usually slaves were used as combatants, but there were weekly contests open to volunteers.
metadata.title: Cruelest Cut

metadata.content:
# Landing Lights Bar - History[]

The bar originally had a band, that played live music. However, a drunken brawl spread onto the bandstand, resulting in their instruments being smashed up. The Wookiee Arrogha was a patron of the bar, and in about 32 BBY, the Heroes of Cularin traveled there, to speak to him.
metadata.title: Landing Lights Bar

metadata.content:
# Voss-Ka Cantina

Voss-Ka cantina


General information

Type
Cantina


Location
Voss-Ka, Voss


[Source]


The Voss-Ka Cantina was a cantina in Voss-Ka, the capital of Voss.

It was run by Saligon.
metadata.title: Voss-Ka Cantina

Irrational Number was a cantina at Jugsmuk Station on the planet Gamorr. It was owned and operated by the Bith known as "Numbers." The Irrational Number was busy but well organized, and allowed patrons to drink and gamble. Rooms were available for rent, and Numbers had an Mark 16 Enzymer console on the premises.
metadata.title: Irrational Number

metadata.content:
# Mazzoney's

Mazzoney's


General information

Location
Selkren, Demophon


[Source]

Mazzoney's was a seedy cantina in the city of Selkren on the planet Demophon. Even when the citizens were in a panic to flee the planet before its sun went supernova, Mazzoney's remained open as a den of decadence and corruption. Mazzoney himself tended the bar. The establishment had a reputation for being a place to find information. In case of trouble the cantina was staffed with Gamorrean bouncers. Mazzoney was known to engage in brawls himself, as well.
metadata.title: Mazzoney's

metadata.content:
# Haunch of Nerf

Haunch of Nerf


General information

Location
Coruscant University quarter, Coruscant


[Source]


The Haunch of Nerf was a restaurant located in the Coruscant University quarter on Coruscant, the capital world of the Galactic Republic. The cantina was designed to appear rustic, and evoke an archaic sense of the working-class past. The alleyway entrance to the Haunch of Nerf was constructed in a mock-ancient style, reminiscent of a baronial fort. The interior of the restaurant was hot, intentionally rough-hewn, and full of inaccurately designed replicas of antique rural feasting trestles. Food at the Haunch of Nerf was served on pleekwood trenchers instead of more contemporary porceplast plates, and the cantina's ale was brewed specially to retain a cloudy appearance full of unidentifiable lumps, thought to be authentic to the ancient aesthetic the Haunch of Nerf aspired to. The Haunch of Nerf typically attracted upper class clientele, and offered private tables away from the main salon.

In the year 19 BBY, the Coruscant University professor of biology, Reye Nenilin, met with the Mandalorian soldier Kal Skirata at the Haunch of Nerf. The two shared a private table with Skirata's colleagues, Mandalorian doctor Mij Gilamar and the undercover Null-class ARC trooper Mereel, while discussing genetics research. Skirata attempted to covertly enlist Nenilin's aid in halting the accelerating aging that afflicted the Republic army's clone troopers, eventually convincing the professor to look over the data he had gathered. Skirata thought little of the Haunch of Nerf's false sense of archaism and the patrons' inaccurate, romanticized ideals of how the working-class common man lived in the past. While he was leaving the cantina, he scoffed at the Haunch of Nerf's mock-ancient exterior, musing that it was likely little more than a year old despite its historical design.
metadata.title: Haunch of Nerf

metadata.content:

Elgerkab's Cantina

Elgerkab's Cantina was located in the city of Ugnorgrad on the Ugnaught Surface. It was the hangout for non-union members. It underwent major reconstruction after its fourth accidental fire in five years.

metadata.content:
# The Drunk Side

The Drunk Side


General information

Location
Dreshdae, Korriban


Builder(s)
Czerka Corporation



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Czerka CorporationMika Dorin


[Source]

The Drunk Side, also known as the Dreshdae Cantina, was a cantina located within the settlement of Dreshdae on the planet Korriban, in operation during the Jedi Civil War. The cantina's bartender, who also managed the establishment, was the Rodian Mika Dorin; he had taken over from the bar's previous owner, who had run afoul of Czerka Corporation over the establishment's operations. Along with spacers and freighter crews who ferried Sith artifacts from the surface, many of the instructors from the nearby Sith Academy would stop by the establishment. Yuthura Ban was the most common face present, often staying there when visiting the colony. While there, she gave final approval to Sith hopefuls who had been given medallions, which signified their worthiness to attend the Academy. When the former Dark Lord of the Sith Revan, who had been mindwiped and retrained by the Jedi Council, came to Korriban in 3956 BBY, he met with Ban at the cantina, gaining her sponsorship to attend the Academy. The cantina was also home to Mika's under-the-table business that sold "premium items," such as prototype Verpine shields and life support packs to special customers.
metadata.title: The Drunk Side

metadata.content:
# The Weary Traveler

The Weary Traveler


General information

Location
Tatooine


[Source]

The Weary Traveler was one of the two small cantinas in Anchorhead on Tatooine during the time of the Clone Wars.

Obi-Wan Kenobi frequented this cantina during the initial stages of his self-imposed exile on Tatooine. It featured a HoloNet receiver, a vaporator, and a selection of offworld brandy. It was here that Obi-Wan learned of Darth Vader's survival after leaving him for dead on Mustafar. Shortly after receiving this news, Obi-Wan was visited for the first time by the Force ghost of Qui-Gon Jinn.
metadata.title: The Weary Traveler

metadata.content:
# Sunken Sarlacc cantina - History[]

The Sunken Sarlacc cantina was a large building located in the Balmorrian city of Sobrik, occupied by the reconstituted Sith Empire during the Cold War.

Even after the Sith took over the town, some of its citizens still spent their time in the cantina during the occupation. However while the patrons were enjoying their drinks, the streets were patrolled by Imperial soldiers and droids, and several security cameras were installed around the building.

Despite all the precautions taken by the Empire to keep the local citizens at bay, the Republic sent their agents in order to weaken the positions of the Sith at Sobrik. At one stage the Republic forces entered the cantina and activated the Republic hymn to inspire the remaining dwellers and freedom fighters to start a riot against the invaders.
metadata.title: Sunken Sarlacc cantina

metadata.content:
# Borke's Cantina

Borke's Cantina


General information

Location
Drepplin, Glova



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Borke Valkanhayn


[Source]

Borke's Cantina was a cantina located in Drepplin, the capital city of the planet Glova.

Owned by Borke Valkanhayn, its prices were average, making the cantina a place frequented, including by the New Republic Agent Trask Lucan. It was primarily used to launder money from Borke's "importing" business. Initially there was a small danger from legal authorities, but Borke made a small "contribution" to the operating funds of several important officials and the problem went away.
metadata.title: Borke's Cantina

metadata.content:
# The Drunk Side - Behind the scenes[]

The cantina was first introduced in the video game Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic. Though it is referred to as the "Dreshdae Cantina" in dialogue, reading the sign next to the entrance shows the name, which is a play on the phrase "The Dark Side."

The player, as Revan, has a number of options dealing with the cantina. However, most of them are unrelated to the player's chosen alignment. With the exception of meeting Yuthura Ban, all other interactions that relate to The Drunk Side are completely optional. However, they do point toward the ultimate quest that has to do with that planet, which is finding the Star Map hidden in the tomb of Naga Sadow. While interacting with Yuthura, the player can choose to lie about their intentions if playing the canonical light side storyline or, if following the dark path, can express an honest desire to join the Sith. If the player has Juhani with them when entering the Valley of the Dark Lords and talks with Dak Vesser, he will flee back to The Drunk Side, intending to run away from the Sith after being discovered. The player has the option to follow him back to the cantina, and either let him go or attempt to kill him; if Juhani is in the party, however, she will prevent the latter choice from occurring.

In addition, the "premium items" quest is not always available, due to how the quest is spawned in the wake of the escape from the Leviathan. It is not certain what triggers the appearance of Ziagrom, who gives the player the option of buying the items from Dorin at the cantina.
metadata.title: The Drunk Side

The Stronghold Cantina (also called Lok cantina or Nym's Cantina) was a popular establishment in the pirate town of Nym's Stronghold on the planet Lok. It was frequented by many members of the Lok Revenants and visitors.

The cantina was situated in the center of the small stronghold, not far from the bazaar, hotel and medical center. It had two entrances, one in the front and one in the back. The cantina featured of a large room with a long, U-shaped bar counter in the middle of the room where a bartender sold beverages. Six large booths along the walls provided tables and chairs where people could sit down, drink and listen to the music. A door behind the counter led to a small back room that wasn't in use as of 1 ABY. Another room in the back of the cantina gave special patrons a little privacy from the other patrons' prying eyes.

Among the beverages available at the bar were Antakarian Fire Dancer, Sith scorcher, Desert bloom, Lopez Softdrink, Ardees Beverage tea, milk and Jawa beer.

The cantina was a franchise of Vanster Enan's Sop House, a cantina that was located in Gadrin, on the planet Cularin. During the SoroSuub celebration in Tolea Biqua in 31 BBY, a number of drinking games took place inside the cantina.

# Stronghold Cantina - Behind the scenes[]

This cantina is a location in Sony Online Entertainment's MMORPG Star Wars Galaxies. The building's layout is identical to Star Wars Galaxies' version of Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina.

Various NPCs can be found here that players have to talk to during quests. It also provides a place for players of the entertainer profession to perform their music and dancing acts and give out buffs.

[Source]


The Near Vacuum Cantina was a cantina that operated on Tolea Biqua on Genarius during the Clone Wars. It had a human bartender and the waitresses, including a Gamorrean one, wore "spacesuit" costumes with transparent arms and legs. It was clean and the drinks were relatively cheap. It had a large fishtank inside it, that ran from the floor to the ceiling and contained amphibians.

The Heroes of Cularin once went there in search of Berpo, a Toydarian criminal who was drinking there, with a female Rodian and a female Twi'lek. Berpo felt threatened by the heroes, so he put a vibrodagger to the Twi'lek's throat and threatened to kill her if they came close to him.

metadata.content:
# Aruk's cantina - History[]

At one time Jedi Master Agen Kolar got into a fight with several of the patrons just before Aruk and his entourage were coming in. Aruk was furious that Kolar was causing trouble in his cantina again as he had several times before and forced him to leave.
metadata.title: Aruk's cantina

metadata.content:
# The Drunk Side - History[]

Built alongside the rest of the settlement, which served as the sector hub of Czerka Corporation operations within Sith Space, the cantina served spacers of many different species. During the Jedi Civil War, hopefuls from around the galaxy gathered there, hoping to demonstrate to any passing Sith that they were worthy to attend the Korriban Sith Academy that had been established by Darth Revan's Sith Empire. Many of these hopefuls were largely ignored, though some were subjected to violent ends by the Academy's student body. At the same time, many freighter crews, contracted with the shipping of Sith artifacts off-world from the excavations within the Valley of the Dark Lords, where many ancient Sith Lords were buried, loitered at the cantina in between jobs. When the establishment's first owner nearly ruined the cantina financially, earning the ire of Czerka Corporation, the Rodian bartender, Mika Dorin, took over the bar's operations. He also began a side business selling "premium" arms and equipment to owners of the Dynamic-class freighter Ebon Hawk.

When the mind-wiped and retrained Jedi Revan, accompanied by his comrades aboard the Hawk, arrived on Korriban in 3956 BBY, he visited the cantina, seeking clues to the location of that planet's Star Map. This ancient piece of Rakatan technology provided data that, combined with information from other Maps, provided the location of the Star Forge, the hidden weapons factory that was the pinnacle of the Infinite Empire and the power behind the Sith war effort. While asking various patrons about the artifact, Revan found that his vessel was the subject of admiration among the pilots and crew that frequented the place. Included among them was the bartender Dorin, who, along with a pair of Human pilots, treated Revan to a brief and admiring history of the Hawk and the "services" it had performed in the past. This included describing the ship's true purpose, smuggling, and information about those who had owned the vessel previously. Some time later, after securing a Sith Medallion from a student he had killed in order to defend a woman that the Sith had been threatening, Revan returned to the cantina to present the icon to the Twi'lek instructor Yuthura Ban. Ban, who was apprenticed to the Sith Master Uthar Wynn, was considered second-in-command at the Academy, and was intrigued by Revan's power in the Force. She voiced her suspicions that there was more to Revan than he claimed. Revan, however, managed to persuade her that he wished to join the Sith, as getting into the Academy was the only way to reach the Valley and the Map that he suspected was to be found there.

After being accepted into the Academy, Revan and one of his companions, the Cathar Padawan Juhani, met a Sith archaeologist named Dak Vesser in the Valley of the Dark Lords. Not wanting to have anything to do with either of them or whatever had brought them to Korriban, Vesser took refuge in the cantina prior to departing the planet, but not before telling Revan about the tombs in the Valley and speaking with Juhani about their past as fellow Jedi trainees. When the Academy fell into chaos following the death of the headmaster, Wynn, and the redemption of Ban to the light side following Revan's double-cross and betrayal within the tomb of Naga Sadow, the cantina continued to do business. Eventually, Dorin, with the assistance of his partner Ziagrom, learned of Revan's true identity as the former Dark Lord of the Sith, and offered him access to the premium items they sold, including thermal detonators, life support packs, prototype personal shields, and advanced armor suits. Prior to setting out for Lehon and the Star Forge, Revan again returned to the cantina to partake in this continuation of the under-the-table business that the pair had traditionally carried out with prior owners of the Ebon Hawk.

By 3951 BBY, Korriban was largely abandoned. When Meetra Surik arrived on the ancient Sith world sometime that year, she found the Academy deserted and access to Dreshdae blocked, forcing Atton Rand, serving as pilot, to land the Hawk in the Valley of the Dark Lords itself. Infighting among the Sith in the years following the Jedi Civil War had rendered the planet virtually uninhabited.
metadata.title: The Drunk Side

metadata.content:
# Vanster Enan's Cantina (Tolea Biqua franchise)

Vanster Enan's Cantina (Tolea Biqua franchise), also known as just Vanster Enan's Cantina was a cantina that was located in the city Tolea Biqua, on the planet Genarius.
metadata.title: Vanster Enan's Cantina (Tolea Biqua franchise)

metadata.content:
# Unidentified Iziz cantina

Unidentified Iziz cantina


General information

Location
Iziz, Onderon


[Source]


A cantina was located in the Western Square of Iziz, the capital city of Onderon.

Dhagon Ghent and his friends often went to the Iziz Cantina prior to the Onderon Civil War. It had a swoop track running under the city. When Captain Sullio was shot after leaving the cantina, Ghent was wrongly accused of the crime and immediately arrested. When Meetra Surik and Mandalore Canderous Ordo, one of Ghent's friends, came to the cantina, they were able to prove Ghent's innocence with the help of a Beast Rider named Panar, a slicer named Kiph, and Nikko, one of Ghent's other friends.

While in the cantina, the Exile gave one of her starport visas to a Republic spy named Xaart, although two other patrons, Gormo and Sakarie, also asked for a visa. Later, a Beast Rider named Bakkel attacked the Exile when she asked for one of her holodiscs, to give to Ghent. Later, with the help of Ghent, the Exile arranged a meeting with Jedi Master Kavar, but during the meeting Colonel Tobin tried to capture them. Kavar force stunned Tobin's men and fled to the Iziz Royal Palace, while the Exile had to fight her way through the Western Square and the Merchant Quarter, before reaching the Iziz Starport, and the Exile fled back to Dxun.
metadata.title: Unidentified Iziz cantina

metadata.content:
# Lurbi's Mercantile

Lurbi's Mercantile was based on the Landing in the planet Engebo V and was a hotel, cantina, and general store which belonged to a Gotal named Lurbi.
metadata.title: Lurbi's Mercantile

Sunken Sarlacc cantina was a public drinking and dining establishment in the city of Sobrik, Balmorra during the days of the Galactic Republic.
metadata.title: Sunken Sarlacc cantina

metadata.content:
# Invisible Hand cantina - History[]

It was decorated with old Separatist recruitment posters, war memorabilia, and pieces of alloy that were supposedly parts of the Invisible Hand that fell on the ground during its destruction in the Battle of Coruscant. The Gran Klef worked there as a bartender and the Quarren Tekkur was a bouncer.

The Imperial Security Bureau agent, Tavik Moern once lured an Alderaanian Resistance team there and, along with four Quarren thugs, attacked them.
metadata.title: Invisible Hand cantina

metadata.content:
# Uncle Chesko's

Uncle Chesko's


General information

Locations
Nar Shaddaa


[Source]


The moon Nar Shaddaa, located in Hutt Space, contained a seedy bar called Uncle Chesko's, which was a worn-out tapcafe near a freighter port. By sometime during the final years of the Clone Wars, a conflict that lasted from 22 to 19 BBY, the music within Uncle Chesko's attracted the Yuzzum J'ywz'gnk Kchhllbrxcstk Et'nrmdndlcvtbrx, who burst into song and attracted the attention of others in the bar, while the band Evar Orbus and His Galactic Jizz-Wailers was performing at Uncle Chesko's. Due to his delighted surprise at Et'nrmdndlcvtbrx's performance, the eponymous lead musician invited the Yuzzum to join the band.
metadata.title: Uncle Chesko's

metadata.content:
# Merl's

Merl's was a cantina located in Muracie on Centares. It was owned by Merl. Food from Merl's was smuggled to Tyler Lucian. Merl and his bouncers, Glocken and Uri, were killed in a firefight with Beilert Valance, when the bounty hunter tried to get Merl to reveal the hiding place of Lucian.
metadata.title: Merl's

metadata.content:
# The Drunk Side - Description[]

The cantina itself was a simple affair, constructed as an extension of the Dreshdae settlement building, and only sparsely-decorated. Consisting of a single rectangular room, its long, U-shaped bar jutted out from the far wall nearly the full length of the establishment, while seats and small tables lined the sides.
metadata.title: The Drunk Side

metadata.content:
# Stronghold Cantina - Inhabitants and patrons[]

Among the beings who visited this cantina regularly in 1 ABY were the retired Sergeant Moore, musician Vixur Webb, retired engineer Choster, CorSec Commander Ramna, the gambler Berema, and the smugglers and Rebel Alliance members Nien Nunb, Chewbacca and Han Solo. The slicer Kaibe could also often be found outside of the cantina.
metadata.title: Stronghold Cantina

metadata.content:
# Blue Brubb

Blue Brubb


General information

Location
Mos Espa, Tatooine


[Source]


The Blue Brubb was a cantina in Mos Espa on Tatooine. It was known to serve the drink, Ruby bliel. It was located in a part of town controlled by Jabba Desilijic Tiure.
metadata.title: Blue Brubb

metadata.content:
# Sunken Sarlacc cantina - Layout[]

The cantina consisted of several corridors and medium rooms, as well as a large hall, where people gathered to have drinks and relax. Several holographic dancers entertained the patrons.

The interior design of the bar was based upon the Imperial style, which may have been due to Imperial renovations made in the city.
metadata.title: Sunken Sarlacc cantina

metadata.content:
# Platform 6 cantina - Behind the scenes[]

The Platform 6 cantina appears as an area on Zakuul in the Star Wars: The Old Republic: Knights of the Fallen Empire expansion.
metadata.title: Platform 6 cantina

metadata.content:
# HyperDive Cantina

The HyperDive Cantina was a cantina that was part of the Fathoms resort located within Wildwater City on the world of Dac. It was owned by the undercover Rebel Alliance agent Baydo Chasdy who employed a Kian'thar named Lliegis'Nevz as bartender.
metadata.title: HyperDive Cantina

metadata.content:
# Jerf Huxley's cantina

Jerf Huxley's cantina


General information

Location
Outer Rim Territories



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Huxlings


[Source]

Jerf Huxley's cantina was a cantina in the Outer Rim Territories that was frequented by smugglers including Jerf Huxley and his Huxlings. Its decor was markedly different from cantinas on Coruscant and the other Core Worlds, including gaudy wall hangings, old plumbing and polished droid parts from before the Clone Wars. The cantina had unbreakable mugs and stone-topped tables, both signs of the frequent blaster fights that took place there.

In 22 ABY, Mara Jade Skywalker met with Huxley at the cantina to terminate Talon Karrde's working relationship with the Huxlings. This prompted Huxley to confront Jade Skywalker and try extracting a severance payment from Karrde, with the aid of about twenty Huxlings, including Sinker.
metadata.title: Jerf Huxley's cantina

metadata.content:
# Vanster Enan's Sop House

Vanster Enan's Sop House was a cantina located in Gadrin. It was one of the liveliest and loudest cantinas on Cularin, being on a supply route from the river to the docking bays in Hedrett. It was usually known for raucous music. The house special was a "fine Ithorian brandy," which was actually a homebrew which Vanster Enan, an Ithorian, made from Cularin tree sap.

On the 200th anniversary of Reidi Artom's founding of Gadrin, a young man named Darin burst into the Sop House crying out that Cularin was in danger. He was followed by security guards in House Hirskaala uniforms who arrested him and took him away. This instigated some of the Sop House's patrons to look into the matter, which ended with them uncovering and bringing down a pirate ring.

The Sop House was also a site of much partying during a celebration over the defeat of the Metatheran Cartel a little over a month later. It sent representation to the SoroSuub Anniversary celebration, 31 BBY in Genarius.
metadata.title: Vanster Enan's Sop House

metadata.content:
# The Drunk Side - Inhabitants[]

The Drunk Side was frequented primarily by transient beings, mostly Humans, Twi'leks, or Rodians, which included spacers on layover, freighter crews awaiting a new shipment off-planet, those hoping to become students at the Sith Academy that had been established not far from Dreshdae, and Sith students themselves. The most prominent patron was easily Yuthura Ban, who, when not teaching at the Academy, would loiter in the cantina, waiting to pass final judgment on those who had acquired Sith medallions. Pazaak was also a popular pastime at the cantina; the Rodian Toll Apkar was often present and willing to play a few hands.
metadata.title: The Drunk Side

metadata.content:
# Reggilio's Cantina

Reggilio's Cantina was a cantina in Iltarr City on the planet Wukkar.
metadata.title: Reggilio's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Sunken Sarlacc cantina - Behind the scenes[]

The cantina is one of the locations to be visited by the players of the MMORPG Star Wars: The Old Republic during the quest given by the Republic characters. Activating the speaker with the "Republic March," originally from the previous video game by BioWare, Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic, is part of a larger mission to infiltrate the city of Sobrik.
metadata.title: Sunken Sarlacc cantina

metadata.content:

Narissa

Red Light Sector, Nar Shaddaa

Cantina


[Source]


The Heartache Bistro was a cantina located in Nar Shaddaa's Red Light Sector. Though initially a poor, rarely visited location, a new owner named Narissa helped to transform the Bistro into one of Nar Shaddaa's premier restaurants. During the Galactic Civil War, the Bistro entered into an agreement with a Hutt kajidic to sell Tempest spice.
metadata.title: Heartache Bistro

metadata.content:
# Montalvia cantina

A cantina was located on the Inner Rim planet Kyrouac during the Galactic Civil War.
metadata.title: Montalvia cantina

metadata.content:
# Platform 6 cantina

Platform 6 cantina


General information

Location
Platform 6, Zakuul


[Source]


The Platform 6 cantina was a cantina located on Platform 6 in the Old World of Zakuul. It was owned by the Wookiee Bowdaar in the aftermath of the Eternal Empire conquest. The cantina was directly connected to the Arena Grand, the main gladiatorial arena on Zakuul.

In 3631 BBY, during the War against Zakuul, Senya Tirall arranged a meeting with Reg in the cantina, but was ambushed by Aitan Brewgs and the Heralds of Zildrog instead.
metadata.title: Platform 6 cantina

metadata.content:
# Moshi Bar - History[]

In 21 BBY, Moshi Bar was visited by Jedi Master Plo Koon and Jedi Padawan Ahsoka Tano searching for information on Jango Fett. A fight was going to erupt in the tavern due to Ahsoka's eavesdropping, but was prevented from Ahsoka's distraction and Leo's reluctance for his bar to be damaged.
metadata.title: Moshi Bar

metadata.content:
# Umbra Club

Umbra Club


General information

Location
Sector 1459, Coruscant 


[Source]


The Umbra Club was a seedy, underworld cantina and nightclub that was situated within Sector 1459, in the undercity of the planet Coruscant. Outside the club were elaborate holovid screens that gave the false impression that it was an upscale establishment. The club, which was run by Omacala, was a popular haunt of death stick dealers and addicts, and during the early years of the Galactic Empire, various thugs loyal to the Human death stick dealer Speng operated opening within the club. The Kadas'sa'Nikto bounty hunter Kaa'to Leeachos was a patron of the club and after Leeachos earned the ire of the Pyke Syndicate and went into hiding, a group of Pyke-affiliated agents ventured to the Umbra Club in search of information on the Nikto's activities.
metadata.title: Umbra Club

metadata.content:
# Nobody's Inn

Nobody's Inn


General information

Location
Ord Mantell


[Source]

Nobody's Inn was a cantina on Ord Mantell.
metadata.title: Nobody's Inn

metadata.content:
# Frundle's Cantina

Frundle's Cantina


General information

Location
Naboo


[Source]

Frundle's Cantina was a local in the city of Keren, on Naboo. It was known to have expensive drinks on tap, and therefore loss business to surrounding pubs.

On 31 BBY, local Kubaz informer Talbrek staged a meeting between Army of Life agent Del Binjitt and some independent agents he wanted to hire to transport clodhopper eggs to Stend IV. Binjitt hired the agents and gave them valuable information. However, the bartender droid was eavesdropping and reported its discoveries to the authorities, who were watching Binjitt.
metadata.title: Frundle's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Red Moon Saloon

Red Moon Saloon


General information

Location
Mos Eisley, Tatooine


[Source]


The Red Moon Saloon was a cantina on Mos Eisley, Tatooine.

It was the site of a meeting between a group of Rebels and a smuggler named Tal Pak and his henchman Vassk. The Rebels were looking for a supply of parts for the Alliance Fleet's starships. After negotiating a deal, Pak revealed the location of the parts was the Imperial training facility on Sirpar. Before he could leave with his credits, Vassk double-crossed him and the Rebels. The henchman planned to turn them all over to the Empire for a bounty. The Rebels managed to defeat the stormtroopers who responded and fled the scene.

An incident occurred at the cantina in 1 ABY, which involved seven barrels of Zelosian wine, the Force-sensitive Gamorrean brothers Thok and Gorc, a Kloo horn, three Gungan patrons who had been bludgeoned to death, and five fricasseed Ugnaught patrons. This also resulted in the arrest and separation of the two brothers by the Imperial Prophetess Sariss, resulting in Thok being placed in Prefect Orun Depp's prisons and Gorc being made into a sithspawn after the former squealed about the latter's Force-sensitivity.
metadata.title: Red Moon Saloon

metadata.content:
# Krakin's Alehouse

Krakin's Alehouse


General information

Location
Cularin


[Source]

Krakin's Alehouse was a cantina that was located on the planet Cularin during the waning years of the Galactic Republic. It was established by an individual named Krakin and later fell into the hands of the Trandoshan Sossk, who had owned it for fifteen years by the time of the Clone Wars. After the crime lord Nirama was deposed by the Hutt Riboga, a number of criminals who had formerly worked for Nirama visted Krakin's Alehouse and discussed the experiences that they had while working for Nirama.
metadata.title: Krakin's Alehouse

metadata.content:
# Jekk'Jekk Tarr - History[]

The Exchange crime lord Visquis would often use the bar for dealings he wanted kept secret from Goto, having discovered accidentally at some point that Goto could not monitor events that happened inside the Jekk'Jekk Tarr. This was because droids did not function properly inside of it. During her time on the moon in 3951 BBY, the Jedi Exile was lured here by Visquis in his attempt to claim the Exchange's outstanding bounty on Jedi. She survived the hostile environment using the Force, harnessing the power of breath control in order to conserve oxygen and to prevent the gases from being inhaled. When Visquis saw that the gas had no effect on her, he commanded the bounty hunters and other bar patrons within to attack her, offering a huge reward to whoever took her down. She was attacked by a Devaronian bartender and a Twi'lek majordomo, among others, before eventually reaching Visquis's private room. During the battle, she convinced the Lunar Shadow captain to go back to his crew before continuing her pursuit through the tunnels below the cantina and into Visquis's lair. Upon returning at a later time, the Exile found that the Jekk'Jekk Tarr had been closed.
metadata.title: Jekk'Jekk Tarr

metadata.content:
# Unidentified bar (Dubrava)

A bar was located in the Canal District of the planet Dubrava. The bar sat on an island in the swamp, connected to nearby islands by a system of waterways and a pier-like bridge system. In 0 ABY, the Human pilot Jal Te Gniev acted as a Rebel Alliance recruiter from the establishment. At this same time, the bartender was a Snivvian. Due to Gniev's drunkenness, the Galactic Empire discovered the name of Luke Skywalker as the pilot who had destroyed the Death Star. Gniev's blunder also brought a group of stormtroopers to the bar, where they burned it to the ground with flamethrowers.
metadata.title: Unidentified bar (Dubrava)

metadata.content:
# Rii Jenks Cantina

Rii Jenks Cantina


General information

Location
Formos


[Source]


The Rii Jenks Cantina was a cantina and dining establishment that operated on the planet Formos during the reign of the Galactic Empire. The cantina was situated close to the rundown Formos Spaceport and it attracted a diverse, cosmopolitan range of customers. The establishment was run by the aged Bith Rii Jenks and Jenks paid regular bribes to Imperial agents and local Hutt crime lords to dissuade them from interring with his business, while he also evaded the ire of local smuggler groups by permitting them to make use of the cantina's facilities.
metadata.title: Rii Jenks Cantina

metadata.content:
# The Nexu's Den

The Nexu's Den


General information

Location
Rodia


[Source]

The Nexu's Den was a spaceport cantina on Rodia during the Imperial era.
metadata.title: The Nexu's Den

metadata.content:
# Nashal cantina - Description[]

The cantina was situated only few meters from the banks of the Mephyt River, not far from the city's spaceport. It had two entrances, one in the front and one in the back. The cantina consisted of a large room with a long, U-shaped bar counter in the middle of the room where a bartender sold beverages. Six large booths along the walls provided tables and chairs where people could sit down, drink and listen to the music. A door behind the bar led to a small back room that wasn't in use as of 1 ABY. Another room in the back of the cantina gave special patrons a little privacy from the other patrons' prying eyes.

Among the beverages available at the bar were Adumari beer, Lopez Softdrink, Ardees Beverage tea, milk and imported Utozz.
metadata.title: Nashal cantina

metadata.content:
# Morbo's Place

Morbo's Place


General information

Zalxuc City, Thyferra



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Voralla Morbo


[Source]

Morbo's Place was a cantina in Zalxuc City on Thyferra.
metadata.title: Morbo's Place

metadata.content:
# Unidentified Coruscant cantina - History[]

This cantina contained a central bar, two special rooms where guests could be alone as well as multiple Twi'lek dancers and a band composed of three Bith and an Ithorian.

Around the year 21 BBY, bounty hunters Chata Hyoki and Robonino came to this cantina to talk to Count Dooku about an assassination attempt on senator Padmé Amidala.
metadata.title: Unidentified Coruscant cantina

metadata.content:
# Jekk'Jekk Tarr - Behind the scenes[]

The Jekk'Jekk Tarr first appears in the video game Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords. The cantina and the base below it were originally intended to have been one of the lairs of the secretive bounty hunter guild known as the GenoHaradan. However, this was cut from the final game and the base became the stronghold of Visquis' faction of the Exchange.

The player can enter the Jekk'Jekk Tarr without a spacesuit before the quest to rescue Mira activates without any consequences to the Exile's health, provided that she is equipped with a gas mask; if this is done, she can contact the Lunar Shadow captain before the bar patrons become hostile. The Exile can also recruit Odis to be the new captain for the Lunar Shadow crew before entering the cantina. Nevertheless, the former captain cannot be killed, and is the only patron to remain neutral during the skirmish.

Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords, the only source thus far in which the Jekk'Jekk Tarr appears, misspells the cantina's name once as Jek'Jek Tarr, within the Music list accessible from the game's menu screen.
metadata.title: Jekk'Jekk Tarr

metadata.content:
# The Haven

The Haven was a cantina established by Womwa, an Ithorian, on a remote planet in the Mid Rim. The cantina was a front, however, for Womwa's lucrative spice smuggling operations.
metadata.title: The Haven

metadata.content:
# Cikartan's tapcaf

Cikartan's tapcaf


General information

Keldabe, Mandalore



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
MandaloriansCikartan


[Source]

Cikartan's tapcaf was a tapcaf located within the planet Mandalore's capital city of Keldabe, and owned by the Mandalorian Cikartan. The tapcaf was in operation during the Second Galactic Civil War, and it's patrons during that time were acquainted with the Mandalorian soldier Venku Skirata. During Skirata's dealings with reigning Mand'alor Boba Fett, he informed the aging bounty hunter that he could be reached via contacts at Cikartan's.
metadata.title: Cikartan's tapcaf

metadata.content:
# Shilley's

Shilley's was a cantina on Questal owned by Tan Shilley.
metadata.title: Shilley's

metadata.content:
# Krakin's Alehouse - Description[]

The cantina was filled with a pale yellow mist and the sound of cheap music, which was played from a set of old speakers. The building contained a number of small, round tables that were surrounded by durasteel chairs, for the patrons to sit on.
metadata.title: Krakin's Alehouse

metadata.content:
# Saber's Tooth

The Saber's Tooth was a cantina located at the Yefowr spaceport on Taskeed. A halfway-respectable establishment, it smelt strongly of carababba tabac and intoxicants. It had a lively gambling scene, with patrons able to play sabacc, Nierer's folly, two-hand, and dootch. Celia Durasha and Kaj Nedmak met with Bwahl the Hutt in the Saber's Tooth to pick up a smuggling run to Tammuz-an.
metadata.title: Saber's Tooth

metadata.content:
# Avilatan's Rest - Behind the scenes[]

Avilatan's Rest is a location found in the massively multiplayer online role-playing game Star Wars: The Old Republic released by BioWare in 2011. The cantina is similar to many others in the game in that it is an area in which players can speak to their companion characters or buy jukebox tokens to listen to music.
metadata.title: Avilatan's Rest

metadata.content:
# Saludi's - Description[]

Saludi's was a small cantina that operated on the planet Coruscant during the waning years of the Galactic Republic. The bar was built inside part of an old bunker situated in Coruscant's undercity, far from any natural light. The name of the cantina was derived from the term "Saludi", a word from a dialect of the language Huttese that translated into Basic as "hidden". Outside, the cantina had a glowing neon sign that displayed the message "SALUDI's - FAVORITE OF PILOTS ACROSS THE GALAXY" and flashed on a color cycle from red to green, to blue to violet before repeating.

A typical spacer bar, Saludi's was abuzz with a riot of sounds and fragrances, giving it a raucous but not unpleasant atmosphere. The cantina's interior was decorated with the same vibrant color scheme as the neon sign outside and a haze of thin smoke hung in the air. This was produced by the Alderaanian meat seasoning p'chab, which could be purchased in the bar and gave Saludi's distinctive sharp smell, different to most other cantinas. Live music from a band resonated through the bar and raised stools were located throughout for patrons to sit on, intermixed by a number of hovering stools. Alcoholic beverages could be purchased on the premises.

The cantina attracted individuals from across the breadth of the galaxy including spacers, soldiers, criminal pilots and other criminals. Its clientele included old, well-traveled spacers and young hotshot pilots, as well as military pilots from worlds such as Coruscant and Naboo, and civilian-attired pilots from the planets Alderaan and Corellia. The bar's denizens were wary of the Jedi, an order of monastic warriors allied with the Republic. Around the time of the Invasion of Naboo, the one-eyed Human Chez O'nder worked as a bartender at Saludi's and like to regale to the patrons of the bar with a tale of how he had fused his lips together by picking his teeth with a lightsaber, a weapon commonly wielded by Jedi. The Wookiee Colara worked as a bouncer at the bar and was ever diligent in her duties, always on the lookout for potential troublemakers.

The bar had a concealed backroom used for gambling, which could accessed via the cantina's restroom if one pressed a specific tile on the far-left wall that was 11 tiles across, 38 tiles down from the ceiling. Via a trapdoor beneath a table in the room was an access point to a network of tunnels that lay beneath Saludi's. The tunnels connected the bar to a nearby hidden base operated by the Believers, a Sith-worshipping cult from the Cularin system.
metadata.title: Saludi's

metadata.content:
# Avilatan's Rest

Avilatan's Rest


General information

Location
Fort Garnik on Ord Mantell



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Galactic Republic


[Source]

Avilatan's Rest was a cantina built in the Republic-held Fort Garnik on the planet Ord Mantell. It was open during the Cold War and served a large number of Republic soldiers and Mantellian Troopers who were stationed in Garnik to fight in the Separatist War.

The cantina consisted of one large main room with a single raised side room accessible by a ramp. It contained a jukebox and a two separate bars which were staffed by at least two Twi'leks, one of whom, named Ryn, sold jukebox tokens, and a pair of astromech droids. Republic ethics officer Drage was known to drink there.

An individual visited Ethics Officer Drage while he was there to report the existence of a minefield obstacle course set up by Corporal Dregg and Ensign Ta.
metadata.title: Avilatan's Rest

metadata.content:
# Saludi's - History[]

Saludi's opened between around 91 BBY and 81 BBY, located in part of a bunker that dated back to an earlier time of war. By around 31 BBY, the Human Chez O'nder had became a part-owner and bartender of the cantina and he hired out the hidden Saludi's backroom to a group of spice-using Twi'lek gamblers. Unknown to O'nder, the Twi'leks received a fee from the Believers every time one of the cultists passed through the room to reach the access point to their hideout. As a result of a surge in Believer activity, the gamblers earned a profit from renting the room.

One evening, while O'nder and Colara were at work in the bar, a group of soldiers of the Mecetti House Guard, a military force from the Tapani sector, came to Saludi's to drink. Colara kept watch on the soldiers, looking for an excuse to throw them out. The playboy freighter captain Xav Verivax also ventured to the cantina and attempted to chat up some Twi'lek females. Around the same time, a group of Believers passed through the bar while returning to their secret base with a Mandalorian iron box containing a fragment of the dark side city Conkesta, which the cultists had stolen from a Coruscant landing platform.

Minutes after the arrival of the Believers, a group of freelance agents arrived at Saludi's in pursuit of the stolen box, just as Colara ejected a drunken Gamorrean from the bar. The agents made enquires around the cantina as to where the Believers had gone and learned of the hidden back room. The freelancers then entered the concealed room, interrupting a game of sabacc being played by the Twi'lek gamblers, and made their way into the tunnels beneath Saludi's to confront the cultists.
metadata.title: Saludi's

metadata.content:
# Azure Dianoga Cantina

The Azure Dianoga Cantina was a bar located in the Alien Protection Zone on Imperial Center. It was used by members of Rogue Squadron as a meeting place while on an undercover mission before their liberation of the world. The Rogues got into a conflict with the Alien Combine there.
metadata.title: Azure Dianoga Cantina

metadata.content:
# Naked Hutt Cantina

Naked Hutt Cantina


General information

Location
Omman


[Source]


The Naked Hutt Cantina was a cantina on the planet Omman.
metadata.title: Naked Hutt Cantina

metadata.content:
# Saludi's - Behind the scenes[]

Saludi's was created by Morrie Mullins and featured in Coruscani Dawn, a 2002 roleplaying adventure that formed part of the Living Force campaign. The adventure advises that the cantina should be depicted as having a similar atmosphere to the Mos Eisley Cantina, a bar that appeared in the 1977 film Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, but with a more alien ambience.

In the adventure, the player characters roleplay as the freelance agents who come to Saludi's while tracking the Believers and their stolen Mandalorian iron box. The agents can interact with the inhabitants of the bar while searching for information on the cultists' movements and this can play out in various different ways. It is possible for the Jedi Knight Devan For'deschel to accompany the agents to the bar, in which case the cantina's denizens eye her and any Jedi player characters warily, though do not cause any trouble unless provoked. If the player wish to speak with the bartender Chez O'nder, he is initially unavailable due to being busy serving drinks but later becomes free and it is possible for him to provide the agents with details of the secret back room. The player characters can also bribe or otherwise persuade the spacers and soldiers drinking in the bar to provide them information on the concealed gambling room.

An alternative eventuality is that the agents attempt to persuade the Wookiee bouncer Colara to provide them information, though she only speaks to them of the back room if a Wookiee among the player characters agrees to go on a date with her. It is also possible for the player characters to become involved in a confrontation with the House Mecetti soldiers relaxing in the cantina. This can erupt into a bar fight, in which case Colara intervenes to break up the brawl.
metadata.title: Saludi's

metadata.content:
# Jaded Jawa

The Jaded Jawa cantina was located at the Kothlis Starport. The establishment boasted a long transparisteel window that allowed patrons to look out, however, outsiders could not see in. This feature made the cantina a good location to spy on someone. The Jaded Jawa was known as a hotspot for illegal drugs and was never very busy. The food was poor and the drinks were unimaginative. The main reason that people visited the bar was for information. Dakkar owned this locale at the height of the Galactic Empire.
metadata.title: Jaded Jawa

metadata.content:
# Junkfort Station cantina

The Junkfort Station cantina was a drinking establishment located aboard the space station known as Junkfort Station.
metadata.title: Junkfort Station cantina

metadata.content:
# Nashal cantina - Employees and patrons[]

A bartender and the Ithorian chef Oecax worked in this cantina.

Among the beings who visited this cantina regularly in 1 ABY were the Bith Sigrix Slix and the Drall Green Laser. The revived Durge temporarily hid in the back room of the cantina.
metadata.title: Nashal cantina

metadata.content:
# LoBue Cantina

LoBue Cantina


General information

Location
Abregado-rae Spaceport, Abregado-rae


[Source]


Located in the Abregado-rae Spaceport on the planet Abregado-rae, the LoBue Cantina was a bar and casino located near the Old Patch. Despite seeming small on the outside, the inside was the location of not only a bar and dance floor, but also a good number of tables. Notable at the cantina were Kampl and Cyru, the security guards, and a huge, bushy-bearded regular known only as The Reverend.

About a year before the Battle of Yavin, Han Solo and Chewbacca visited LoBue. A holochess game between the Wookiee and a Weequay became violent when Chewbacca became angered by a move made by his opponent. Fynn Torve, a smuggler who worked for Talon Karrde once met with and Lando Calrissian at the LoBue Cantina.
metadata.title: LoBue Cantina

metadata.content:
# Lucky's Tavern

Lucky's Tavern


General information

Location
Cloud City


[Source]

Lucky's Tavern was a cantina built on Floating Home before it eventually transitioned into Cloud City. Built by Lucky Malnock, it was well situated and originally catered to miners and construction workers. As the colony expanded, the location of the bar meant that its clientele became more suited to administrative workers. Malnock ended up selling the place to a group of investors. After passing through a series of owners, Lucky's Tavern was bought by Jacc Mandelbrot. Mandelbrot bought neighboring properties and knocked them through into one location, creating the Royal Casino.
metadata.title: Lucky's Tavern

Nashal cantina

Nashal, Talus

The cantina was a popular establishment in the town of Nashal on the planet of Talus.

Jekk'Jekk Tarr


General information

Location
Nar Shaddaa



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
The Exchange


[Source]

The Jekk'Jekk Tarr was a cantina that was located within the spaceport docks of Nar Shaddaa and circulated cyanogen fumes along with a variety of other pollutants that were lethal to Humans and Nikto, but commonplace for, and often preferred by, many other alien species. Before its establishment as a cantina, it was a ventilation system for passing nagnol gases to the docks. It was designed to be a haven for the more exotic species of the galaxy; its very atmosphere providing a buffer against less desirable company. Instead of serving drinks, the bar served "nutrient chemicals" to its clientèle, who paid large sums of credits for the privilege.
metadata.title: Jekk'Jekk Tarr

Nexus Room


General information

Constructed
Before 3954 BBY

Kaas City, Dromund Kaas


[Source]


The Nexus Room was a cantina in the southern quadrant of Kaas City on the planet Dromund Kaas during the Cold War-era of galactic history. The cantina had installed a trio of musician droids known as the Leisurenauts to preform a selection of programmed musical tracks when patrons inputted tokens into the cantina's jukebox. Several millennia after the Sith Empire abandoned Dromund Kaas, an archaeological expedition discovered the remnants of the Nexus Room amid the ruins of Kaas City and found the still functioning droid band.
