metadata.content:
# Unidentified Katraasii cantina

Unidentified Katraasii cantina


General information

Constructed
By the year 10 ABY


Location
Katraasii Spaceport, Katraasii


[Source]


A cantina on the planet Katraasii, located in the Katraasii Spaceport, was the favored hangout of Abron Mar, a lieutenant in the crime organization of Takara. The cantina boasted two large dining rooms, one with a bar worked by a bartender. During the year 10 ABY, Mar visited the cantina. However, he was followed by the New Republic Jedi Mara Jade, who was searching for Mar on the behalf of Takara's rival, Ka'Pa the Hutt. After cutting off Mar's escape routes, Jade confronted the lieutenant in the cantina, but Mar escaped through a back door and left his henchmen to deal with Jade.

During this time, the cantina hosted a variety of Human and Ugnaught patrons, Mar's Gran and Weequay henchmen, and a Grave Tusken slept out side the front door. The cantina entertained guests by playing "Mad About Me" over the speakers.
metadata.title: Unidentified Katraasii cantina

metadata.content:
# Saludi's

Saludi's


General information

Constructed
Between c. 91 BBY and 81 BBY,


Location
Coruscant undercity, Coruscant


Point(s) of interest
Concealed gambling room


[Source]

Saludi's was a cantina that operated in the undercity of the planet Coruscant. A typical spacer bar, the cantina was popular with criminals, pilots and soldiers from across the galaxy. The cantina had a concealed back room used for gambling, from which a secret base used by the Believers, a Sith-worshipping cult from the Cularin system, could be reached. Around 31 BBY, a group of freelance agents ventured to the cantina while tracking the Believers and located the access point to the cultists' hideout.
metadata.title: Saludi's

metadata.content:
# The Swirling Vortex

The Swirling Vortex was the most popular spacer bar on the space station Vydat Stardock.

It was owned by the Twi'lek Elav Feen. The bartender was a Wookiee named Orrsa.
metadata.title: The Swirling Vortex

metadata.content:
# Rimmer's Rest - History[]

Like many cantinas all around the galaxy, it was a place for all kinds of creatures to hang out and do business, thanks both to its cosmopolitan character, and the tolerance of weapons and their use; Timmy the bartender kept a blaster rifle underneath the bar table.. The cantina boasted a rich arsenal of all kinds of bottles, decanters, jars, bulbs, and inhalers, with 1,241 different intoxicants. It also provided sample cuisine from every corner of the galaxy.

In 5 ABY the bar was the meeting place between the information broker 8t88 and bounty hunter Boba Fett. Expecting agent Kyle Katarn, the droid wanted Fett to help extract from him information that he wanted; Fett, however, knew of Katarn's exploits on behalf of the Rebel Alliance and knowing that the man was extremely dangerous, declined 88's offer. However, 8t88 found less competent backup, including a Gran and a second bounty hunter.

Indeed, Katarn showed up soon after, according to the droid's invitation, expecting information concerning his father's death holding his Bryar pistol. 8t88 revealed Jerec's responsibility for Morgan's death during the Subjugation of Sulon, and his plans for the rebirth of the Empire. While late to the confrontation, much to 8t88's annoyance, the hirelings moved in around Katarn, leveling their blasters at him and confiscating his. The Gran warned Katarn not to move and brought up the topic of having obtained a holodisc from the home on the moon Sulon, which belonged to Katarn's father. Unable to access the disc's contents due to its encryption, 8t88 attempted to force help from Katarn, which was the actual reason for luring him there. Katarn refused, and 8t88 departed, leaving his hirelings behind to kill Katarn.

Instead of immediately shooting Katarn, the Gran took the vacated seat across the table from him and asked the Rebel agent if he remembered him from their past encounter, giving Katarn the opportunity, in one swift move, to deftly throw the other thug over his shoulder, arm himself again and slide out from the table. The Gran retrieved his E-11 blaster rifle and quickly exited the room, but Katarn followed him to the main bar area and shot him, as did a second Gran near the bar. Timmy demanded that he leave, and Katarn ran after 8t88 and the stolen holodisc.
metadata.title: Rimmer's Rest

metadata.content:
# The Holobar

The Holobar


General information

Location
Entertainment Ring, Nar Shaddaa


[Source]

The Holobar was a popular nightclub that operated in the Entertainment Ring sector of the moon Nar Shaddaa during the time of the Galactic Civil War.
metadata.title: The Holobar

metadata.content:
# Upper City Cantina - The Jedi Civil War[]

The establishment itself, however, was largely unaffected by the conflict, as it continued to serve Tarisian ale and play host to gladiatorial competitions. In 3956 BBY, during the height of the Jedi Civil War, the Sith Empire under Darth Malak conquered the planet in preparation for an ambush on a small fleet supporting a Republic warship, the Endar Spire; the battle was intended to capture the Jedi Padawan Bastila Shan in order to use her battle meditation to ensure the success of his campaign. In the wake of the conquest, the cantina would serve as a place of entertainment for the many troops and officers of the occupation force. Unknown to Malak, however, his former friend and master, whom the Sith Lord had attempted to kill one year previously, was also aboard the ship. Bastila and the amnesiac Revan, along with Carth Onasi, were able to escape the doomed vessel; owing to their abandoning ship in different escape pods, the group became separated, with Shan ending up in the Undercity, where she was quickly captured by a swoop gang known as the Black Vulkars. Carth and Revan, meanwhile, sought refuge in an abandoned apartment not far from the cantina and their pod's crash site, where the former Sith was rendered comatose for three days. Subsequent to the failure to capture or kill Shan in the immediate battle, Malak imposed a planetwide blockade.

After recovering, Revan and Carth visited the cantina to learn about the situation on Taris, conferring with a number of patrons, including Sarna, who invited Revan to a party elsewhere in the Upper City. While at the cantina, Revan expressed an interest in entering the dueling competition being run by Ajuur, which he did under the moniker of the "Mysterious Stranger" in order to raise credits to help find passage offworld. Eventually, after further exploration and involvement in other incidents, including winning the Tarisian Season Opener swoop race, the pair, now joined by Bastila, met with the Mandalorian mercenary Canderous Ordo at the cantina. Ordo, who had grown dissatisfied with working for Davik Kang, had developed a plan for breaking the Sith blockade and leaving the planet. Hoping to bring Revan, Carth and Bastila in to help carry it out, the mercenary offered them a deal: in exchange for obtaining the launch codes necessary to allow a ship to leave the planet unmolested by the Sith fleet, he would provide them with the means of escape—access to Davik's flagship, the Ebon Hawk. With the codes in their possession, the team met up with Ordo at another establishment, Javyar's in the Lower City, for the next step in the plan.
metadata.title: Upper City Cantina

# Blood Bucket

Blood Bucket


General information

Location
Thorsgild


[Source]


The Blood Bucket was a cantina located on the planet Thorsgild. Simms Jonndril frequented the cantina in his youth.

metadata.content:
# Rimmer's Rest

Rimmer's Rest


General information

Location
Nar Shaddaa


[Source]

Rimmer's Rest, also known as Smuggler's Bar, was a cantina on the urbanized moon Nar Shaddaa. A place for seedy people to hang out and do business, the cantina was well stocked with numerous drinks. Rebel agent Kyle Katarn had a shoot-out with local mercenaries in the bar in 5 ABY.
metadata.title: Rimmer's Rest

metadata.content:
# Salla C'airam's cantina

This upscale cantina was owned by the Bergamasque Salla C'airam and located on the planet Sarrish. His establishment had features that were designed to relax his clientele, including soft, dirge-like music, and programmed light shows across the walls. Claiming to cater to a wide range of alien physiology, C'airam's menu boasted a number of intoxicants, including exotic liqueurs. The kitchen was staffed by service droids, and could produce enough food for a large banquet, which C'airam usually reserved for distinguished guests. To prevent violent confrontations and destruction of the decor, C'airam housed a number of ergovores in the entrance and kept them underfed just enough so that they would detect the presence of blaster power packs. The power packs would then be relinquished to the proprietor upon entry to the cantina.

Zuckuss and 4-LOM visited this cantina while tracking Drawmas Sma'Da, a gambler who was wanted by the Galactic Empire for his seemingly-impossible luck with odds and betting in his self-developed galaxy-wide gambling operation, the Invisible & Ineluctable Casino. When Sma'Da arrived, C'airam greeted him with a banquet that had been prepared prior. After a short while, the bounty hunters made their move, with Zuckuss apprehending Sma'Da. He and 4-LOM then removed the gambler from the establishment. C'airam declared them both to be banned from his cantina, though Zuckuss claimed not to care, as "the drinks were terrible, anyway."
metadata.title: Salla C'airam's cantina

metadata.content:
# Sil's Place

Sil's Place was a cantina located on the Westport on Coruscant. The pubtender there was an operative of the group Whiplash.
metadata.title: Sil's Place

# Spacer's Rest

The Spacer's Rest was a cantina on Wroona. Platt Okeefe occasionally bribed Customs Officer Allia with drinks from the cantina.
metadata.title: Spacer's Rest

metadata.content:
# Junix's Joint - History[]

The Anchorhead Cantina was the social and dining establishment of the city of Anchorhead on Tatooine during the Jedi Civil War. Around 3956 BBY the cantina was operated by Junix Nard, who was also the bartender. He employed two Jawa servers, and the establishment featured two Bith musicians and a Twi'lek dancer, as well as a Bith hologram. Nard also ran a small store, but had limited selection as Czerka only worried about keeping their own stores full.

Jedi Knights Revan and Bastila Shan stopped by the cantina in 3956 BBY during their search for the Tatooine Star Map. There Bastila encountered her mother, Helena, whom she had not seen in many years. Also in the cantina at the time was a swoop racing veteran named Gandroff, a pazaak player named Furko Nellis, and two Czerka officers, as well as a handful of other patrons.

It seemed that the bar was a place favored by Czerka officers to relax and worry about their job issues when not working at the Czerka office. Several local people were worrying about issues with the war at the time Revan visited, fearing that if Darth Malak would demolish Taris-a valuable world with billions of people- to defeat the Republic, what grim fate would come to Tatooine if he arrived. However, their fears were unfounded as the Sith Lord was infinitely more concerned with capturing Bastila Shan and conquering the Core Worlds than seizing a remote planet with nothing to offer but sand, savage natives and worthless ore.

In the early days of the Galactic Empire, the cantina, by this point known as Junix's Joint, was staffed by a Duros bartender and his wife, Yoona. Jedi Master Obi-Wan Kenobi stopped at the cantina with the infant Luke Skywalker to ask for directions to the Lars homestead in 19 BBY, in the process becoming involved in a skirmish involving several of Jabba the Hutts thugs.
metadata.title: Junix's Joint

metadata.content:
# Hard Heart Cantina

Hard Heart Cantina


General information

Destroyed
0 BBY


Location
Sector N-One, Death Star I



Chronological and political information

Galactic Empire


[Source]

The Hard Heart Cantina was a cantina on the first Death Star. It was located in Sector N-One. In 0 BBY, an Imperial officer aboard the Death Star shut down the turbolifts to assist in the capture of Luke Skywalker, Han Solo, Obi-Wan Kenobi, and Chewbacca, and proceeded to lament that he was missing the half-price appetizers at the cantina.
metadata.title: Hard Heart Cantina

metadata.content:
# Unidentified Coronet cantina

In 40 ABY, Han Solo, Leia Organa Solo, and Lando Calrissian met with Denjax Teppler in a cantina in Corellia's Coronet City. The cantina was situated on a major thoroughfare close to the city's main spaceport and received many customers during daylight and evening hours. It catered largely to offworlders.

The cantina's bartenders had access to a modified spray-pattern blaster that discouraged any trouble. Waiter droids served customers. Storage and distillery rooms were in the basement immediately below the door. Prior to 40 ABY, tours were available of the microdistillery, and after they ceased, the basement was available to be rented out for private parties and holodrama recordings.
metadata.title: Unidentified Coronet cantina

metadata.content:
# Unidentified cantina (Mari and Boba Fett)

This cantina was a particularly crowded and dim cantina whose owner was not particularly fond of people being killed in the establishment. Thus, when Boba Fett entered the premises and murdered a patron, the bartender yelled at Fett to leave the place. Fett paid a considerable sum of money as compensation and announced to the crowd that he was looking for another target and was willing to pay handsomely for any information that could lead him to her. What he did not know was that she was actually in that very cantina, hiding in the shadows. When he had left, she sneaked out into the streets, but was followed by a group of spacers who ended up helping her complete the mission she was on.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Mari and Boba Fett)

metadata.content:
# Rimsoo Seven cantina

Rimsoo Seven cantina


General information

Location
Republic Mobile Surgical Unit 7, Drongar


[Source]


The Rimsoo Seven cantina was the cantina for the Republic Mobile Surgical Unit 7 on Drongar. It was managed by the Ortolan, Baloob and Mohris was the head bartender.
metadata.title: Rimsoo Seven cantina

metadata.content:
# Rimmer's Rest - Layout[]

Rimmer's Rest was situated in a larger building complex, with only one entrance via a sloping ramp, marked by a light-up snake creature (which looked like an alien hieroglyphic). The cantina proper consisted of two rooms and a small hallway that connected the two. The first room had a large open space and housed the bar. The second room had three booths, each with tables and chairs.

Other places of the establishment had more than a hundred booths that could accommodate both humanoids and non-humanoids, where they could make safe use of stimulant or depressant narcotics. To protect privacy (and hide the lack of hygiene) the ambient lighting was low; blinking white lights marked the aisles. Evenly spaced columns supported the ceiling, rippling with colored rings along their length; the ceiling was made of reflecting tiles.
metadata.title: Rimmer's Rest

metadata.content:
# Mud Puddle

The Mud Puddle was a cantina on Ord Mantell. It was built in a former speeder garage, and a murky puddle lay perpetually in front of its entrance. This forced patrons to get wet when entering, and give rise to its name. The Mud Puddle catered mostly to locals, who regarded strangers with suspicion.

Arthen Brutt was one of these regulars, when he was sought out by the rogue Jedi trainee Dal Konur. Shortly after, a team of operative hired by Luke Skywalker to capture Konur also visited the cantina, gaining information on Konur's whereabouts from Brutt.
metadata.title: Mud Puddle

The Grand Design was a spacer's cantina located near the spaceport on the planet Travnin.

# The Tipsy Mynock

The Tipsy Mynock was a cantina on Karfeddion. Its owners and patrons were great fans of the local smashball team, the Skull Crackers. Lope often visited the Tipsy Mynock when he was on-planet.
metadata.title: The Tipsy Mynock

metadata.content:
# Mong'tar Cantina and Brasserie

Mong'tar Cantina and Brasserie was a seedy and noisy cantina in Mong'tar on Bogg V. It was here where Kal Skirata and Ordo rendezvoused with Mereel and introduced to TK-0 and Gaib.
metadata.title: Mong'tar Cantina and Brasserie

Tiranga's Loft was a cantina owned by the Hutt Tiranga. Rumor had it that Lando Calrissian was a co-owner of the Loft, but such rumors were unsubstantiated.
metadata.title: Tiranga's Loft

metadata.content:
# Upper City Cantina - Layout[]

The Upper City Cantina featured an expansive layout, which consisted of four rooms arranged around a central core, as well as a dueling ring that was located elsewhere within the building. As a visitor entered the establishment, they were met by a collection of pazaak tables where local players would engage in the popular card game. In addition to its prominent bar area, the common area featured an array of tables for guests to sit at; this room also served as a central hub for the rest of the establishment's various rooms.

The room immediately to the left of the entrance and the area dedicated to pazaak was used by Ajuur the Hutt to organize sanctioned duels between amateur or professional combatants who typically competed for a share of the winnings earned by Ajuur through gambling. The duelists who frequented the cantina included Gerlon Two-Fingers, Marl, Ice, Deadeye Duncan, and the champions Twitch and Bendak Starkiller. When not engaged in organized competition, the combatants would often congregate in this area; some would converse with various patrons. In addition, several viewscreens were set up for spectators who were unable to secure tickets to the duels themselves but still wanted to watch the fights. The duel ring itself was circular, with only one entrance; it was surrounded on all sides by stands that could hold a number of spectators. The ring itself was equipped with energy suppressors, so that despite the unrestricted choice of weapons offered the combatants, the chances of being killed in the typical match were very small.

The room of the cantina to the right of the entryway, which was a relatively new addition, contained a bandstand and biological or holographic dancers, which were usually in the form of female Twi'leks. An assortment of tables filled the rest of the room, providing seating for patrons to watch the performers. The final room, which was located directly opposite the entrance into the main area, was laid out as a more private place in which to enjoy drinks and meals. Tarisian nobles would often congregate there, served by wait staff.
metadata.title: Upper City Cantina

metadata.content:
# Vapor Scream

The Vapor Scream was a cantina known for watered-down drinks and catered to spacers and freighter crews. A group of spacers were hired by F'ej D'aw in the Vapor Scream to transport his boss, Nawnam the Hutt off-world.
metadata.title: Vapor Scream

metadata.content:
# Upper City Cantina

Upper City Cantina


General information

Destroyed
3956 BBY


Location
Upper City, Taris



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Tarisian populace


[Source]

The Upper City Cantina was a drinking and dining establishment located in the Upper City of the Outer Rim ecumenopolis of Taris. The cantina was a place where many Tarisians, including nobles, local merchants, pazaak players, and well-off spacers, enjoyed the galaxy-famous Tarisian ale, as well as the famous dueling ring located there. During the Sith Empire's occupation of that world at the height of the Jedi Civil War, many off-duty Sith troopers and officers from the nearby Tarisian Military Base frequently visited the establishment along with its regular customers and offworlders trapped on the planet because of the quarantine, which was aimed at preventing the escape of Bastila Shan. While in search of a way to rescue the missing Jedi, Galactic Republic officer Carth Onasi and the amnesiac former Dark Lord of the Sith Revan visited the cantina in hopes of gathering information on Taris. The establishment, along with much of the surface of Taris, was destroyed as a result of the orbital bombardment of the planet that had been ordered by Darth Malak.
metadata.title: Upper City Cantina

metadata.content:
# Landing Zone

The Landing Zone was a cantina that was located within the Alien Quarter in Spaceport Southeast II on the planet Bonadan.
metadata.title: Landing Zone

categories: Alliance to Restore the Republic locations
metadata.content:
# Anchorhead Tavern - History[]

During the Galactic Civil War, the Anchorhead Tavern served as a front for the activities of the Rebel Alliance. Rebel Captain Nitra Vendallan operated from the cantina after the Battle of Yavin, as well as a Rebel recruitment agent. In addition, Lieutenant Jarad Gastin looked for Rebel sympathizers at the entrance of the building.

In 1 ABY, Imperial Lieutenant Sabol dispatched an agent to infiltrate the cantina in order to steal documents containing information about the location of a high-ranking Rebel officer that the Empire wanted assassinated.

Some time later, the entertainer Anetia Kah'ryn tasked a novice entertainer with performing in the Anchorhead Tavern and gathering information from the patron Borra Setas concerning criminal and Tusken Raider activity in Mos Eisley.
metadata.title: Anchorhead Tavern

The Hoary Piffer was a cantina on the planet Nal Hutta's moon Nar Shaddaa. In the year 19 BBY, it was patronized by Catuman warriors and Shistavanen Wolfwomen, while its entrance was the site of an encounter between fugitive Jedi Master Obi-Wan Kenobi and the fallen Jedi Vima-Da-Boda.

metadata.content:
# Lemo and Sanda's den

Lemo and Sanda's den was the hideout of Lemo and Sanda's gang on the planet Arcan IV. Although primarily the building was used as a location for the gang to hang out, it also served as a cantina, serving drinks to those inside and equipped with booths for people to sit. However, there was a password required to get in the establishment, in order to keep out enemies of the gang. When Lando Calrissian and Chewbacca infiltrated the den, Chewbacca was able to make his way inside by simply roaring at the doorman, perhaps denoting that the security to the hideout was not of the highest caliber.
metadata.title: Lemo and Sanda's den

# Dropview cantina

Dropview Cantina


General information

Location
Jorra, Cato Neimoidia


[Source]

Dropview Cantina was a cantina located in the city of Jorra on the planet Cato Neimoidia. Its name originated from the fact that the cantina was located right on the edge of the bridge on which Jorra was built.

The Dropview was notable for being frequented by offworlders, while most other establishments in Jorra catered only to native Neimoidians. The cantina was also unusual for containing a large amount of Clone Wars memorabilia, and for being backed by the Whitescar Syndicate.
metadata.title: Dropview cantina

Mos Espa's first cantina

A gutted jukebox from Mos Espa's first cantina had been used to fabricate a storage cupboard that was kept in the Skywalker home on Slave Quarters Row in the city of Mos Espa on the desert planet Tatooine by 32 BBY. an illegal alta-wave calibration device was sat by the store's back door.
metadata.title: Mos Espa's first cantina

metadata.content:
# Poodoo Lounge - Description[]

The Poodoo Lounge was a cantina inside an adobe structure. The cantina stood three stories tall, had a street level entrance consisting of a sculpted, arched canopy, and a domed roof.
metadata.title: Poodoo Lounge

Gale's Central Club

metadata.content:
# Kor Vella Cantina - Behind the scenes[]

The cantina in Kor Vella is one of the typical cantinas in the MMORPG Star Wars Galaxies. The developers used the building model that was also used for most other cantinas in the game.

Like all cantinas in the game, it features a bartender that sells a small selection of drinks as well as various Non-Player Characters (NPCs) of random gender, appearance and professon. There are also two NPCs that give out short quests: Lasha Bindari and Skinkner.
metadata.title: Kor Vella Cantina

The Shining Star Cantina was a cantina located near Castle Organa on the Apalis Coast on Alderaan.
metadata.title: Shining Star cantina

metadata.content:
# Upper City Cantina - Inhabitants[]

Many individuals from the Upper City of Taris frequented the cantina, including nobles, well-to-do merchants, off-world traders and other citizens. In keeping with the local tradition of Humanocentrism, the place catered almost exclusively to Human clientèle, as members of non-Human species were generally not allowed to live or work on this highest tier of the ecumenopolis without first obtaining a special permit. The only exceptions to this policy at that time were the reigning dueling champion of that year, a Rodian named Twitch; a trio of Bith musicians who had been stranded on the planet; and a pair of Twi'lek dancers. Other notable denizens included the card shark Niklos; an older pazaak player named Garouk; Gana Lavin, a young noblewoman and her friend, and the duel organizer Ajuur the Hutt. Other patrons included various nobles and citizens; during the quarantine of Taris in the wake of the Sith conquest, patronage was further bolstered by the presence of Sith personnel and off-worlders trapped on the planet because of the blockade. Local reaction to these developments ranged from carefully hidden resentment to open-hearted welcome; some Sith, however, fell prey to the unusually potent nature of Tarisian ale.
metadata.title: Upper City Cantina

metadata.content:
# Custom Stop

Custom Stop


General information

Location
Soco-Jarel Spaceport, Socorro


[Source]


The Custom Stop was a cantina located in Soco-Jarel Spaceport. Run by the hostess and bartender Hhalyia Ahsane, the bar was staffed by six protocol droids. The drink prices were expensive, with the average price being between forty and fifty credits. A stellar-class kitchen offeredlarge meals and could prepare almost anything a spacer desired, including alien delicacies.

Gambling was available at the Custom Stop as well, with games of chance including sabacc, Bounce, and Qul'bukie Joker. Luxury suits were also available for the cost of between two hundred and fifty and five hundred credits a night.

Sordu Gogg, a Rodian information broker and "job doc" worked out of the Custom Stop. he matched spacers to available work, ranging from legitimate cargo hauls to smuggling runs.
metadata.title: Custom Stop

metadata.content:
# Upper City Cantina - Destruction[]

As this was happening, however, Malak grew impatient with the search, which was becoming increasingly fruitless. As a last-ditch attempt to prevent Shan from escaping the planet, he ordered Admiral Saul Karath to conduct an orbital bombardment. After several hours, during which the fleet was repositioned in order to carry out the action with the highest degree of efficiency, the bombardment commenced; turbolaser fire raked the city-world without mercy as automated landers descended to the surface to pick up Sith personnel who were still stationed planetside. The cantina was destroyed by the thorough bombardment.
metadata.title: Upper City Cantina

metadata.content:
# Alien Quarter Cantina

The Alien Quarter Cantina was a restaurant in the galaxy. It served droids, and the Star Tours-aligned F series repair droid F-22-RGKx often visited the restaurant after his business was done for the day.
metadata.title: Alien Quarter Cantina

metadata.content:
# Golden Orb

The Golden Orb was a cantina on Nar Shaddaa located in the Corellian sector. In 5 BBY Han Solo visited the place when he searched for his old friend Mako Spince on the Smugglers' Moon.
metadata.title: Golden Orb

metadata.content:
# Vesari fry-house

The Vesari fry-house was a cantina located in the entertainment district on the planet Coruscant.
metadata.title: Vesari fry-house

Shalo's Cantina

Tatooine


[Source]

Shalo's Cantina was in Mos Eisley located on the planet Tatooine.

It was owned by Shalo who was ordered to Tatooine by the Hutts to manage one of their operations. It was where Han Solo and Jacen Solo met with Shalo to obtain some information regarding the slave traffic to Yuuzhan Vong occupied space.

Sliteye's Entertainment Emporium was a bar located on the outskirts of the Ord Mynock Freeport. It had a glitzy and gaudy facade, but the interior was designed to cater to workers and miners. The Emporium was owned by Zelto Sliteye, and he allowed criminals to use the location as a base of operations. Vasteg the Devaronian forger and Jnoofot the Aqualish mercenary ran their operations out of the Emporium.

metadata.content:
# Upper City Cantina - Behind the scenes[]

The Upper City Cantina was first introduced as a playable sub-level of the Taris Upper City in the video game Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic, developed by BioWare. The player character has a number of alternatives when it comes to the Upper City Cantina. He or she can choose to participate in an illegal death match against Bendak Starkiller for dark-side points, or choose to ignore the dueling ring entirely; despite this, the introductory duel cinematic between Gerlon Two-Fingers and Deadeye Duncan will automatically run when the player enters the duel room. In addition, depending on the gender of the player character, they can be invited to a party, where they can gain a set of Sith armor without resorting to force, by either Sarna if the player is male, or Yun Genda if the player is female; this too is optional.

In cut content, it was possible for Deadeye Duncan to have survived the destruction of Taris; during an interactive cutscene between him and the player on Manaan, he will ask to use the Mysterious Stranger alias. The player was to have the option of questioning him on how he escaped the bombardment, during which Duncan admits that he found an automated transport whose intended passengers had been killed by fallen debris.
metadata.title: Upper City Cantina

metadata.content:
# Qibbu's Hut

Qibbu's Hut


General information

Constructed
Prior to 31 BBY


Location
Entertainment District, Coruscant



Chronological and political information

Affiliation
Qibbu the Hutt


[Source]

Qibbu's Hut was a shady cantina and hotel in Coruscant's entertainment district, owned by Qibbu the Hutt. The waitress was a Twi'lek called Laseema. During the Clone Wars, Kal Skirata demanded that Qibbu let him use the top floor of the Hut as a base of operations. Qibbu agreed to do so, to repay a debt of five hundred thousand credits.
metadata.title: Qibbu's Hut

metadata.content:
# The Chasm - Description[]

The walls of the cantina were built up to make them appear to be made from limestone, to make it look like a chasm. There were platforms at various heights that contained performers, and patrons could reach these by either climbing the walls or by using repulsor lifts. A holographic waterfall was projected next to the bar, although its projector needed maintenance and the waterfall periodically shuddered.
metadata.title: The Chasm

metadata.content:
# The Chasm - History[]

The cantina was originally a warehouse. A bartender named Bolt worked there, along with some Gamorrean security guards and the Rodian comedian Deam Schween. During the time of the Clone Wars, the Dark Jedi Raik Muun attacked the cantina. She left a holorecorder in the cantina's refresher, which was found by one of the patrons, Forg F'lopo. She then entered the cantina in disguise as the Zabrak Jedi Knight Nek Lawsirk and attacked some of the patrons with her lightsaber. F'lopo filmed the whole thing with the holorecorder and the recording helped to decrease the popularity of the Jedi on Cularin.

The Heroes of Cularin, who were trying to find Lawsirk, traveled to the cantina the next day and asked people about what had happened there.
metadata.title: The Chasm

metadata.content:
# Clubs

Clubs


General information

Destroyed
Before 4 ABY


Location
Byrne City, Demophon


[Source]

Clubs was a cantina in Byrne City on the planet Demophon. It was owned by "Ace" Lorle. Lorle used his establishment to gather information on local workers, selling word of any suspicious activities to the Galactic Empire or to corporate interests. Clubs was destroyed during the Demophon supernova.
metadata.title: Clubs

metadata.content:
# Kor Vella Cantina

Kor Vella Cantina


General information

Location
Kor Vella, Corellia


[Source]


The Kor Vella Cantina was a cantina in the city of Kor Vella on the Core World Corellia. The cantina was situated next to a deep chasm running through the city. It was an elongated building with two entrances. Two wind power generators atop the building provided energy for the business.

The interior featured a long bar, where a bartender sold beverages. Along the walls were several booths with tables and chairs where people could sit down and drink. A door behind the counter led to a small back room where music instruments, loudspeakers and other equipment for live acts were stored. Another room in the back of the cantina wasn't in use and empty as of 1 ABY.

Among the regular customers of this cantina were the criminals Lasha Bindari, who worked for Shalera the Hutt, and Skinkner, who worked for the Black Sun syndicate.
metadata.title: Kor Vella Cantina

metadata.content:
# Ion Sandbox

The Ion Sandbox was a cantina in the city of Calamar on Esseles.
metadata.title: Ion Sandbox

metadata.content:
# The Chasm

The Chasm was a cantina that was located in the city of Gadrin, on Cularin. It operated during the waning years of the Galactic Republic.
metadata.title: The Chasm

metadata.content:
# Under the Table

Under the Table was a cantina located in Point Nadir. It was frequented by smugglers, shipjackers, and shady merchants. It was often used by pilots to find new another load after they finished a cargo run. It was also a place where a person could find a ride or hire a ship for a quick and discreet escape from Point Nadir.
metadata.title: Under the Table

metadata.content:
# Wing and Wanderer

Wing and Wanderer


General information

Location
Tatooine


[Source]


The Wing and Wanderer was the name of a cantina on the planet Tatooine. Dao Stryver met Jet Nebula and Clunker at this cantina in 3643 BBY.
metadata.title: Wing and Wanderer

metadata.content:
# Palitoy Cantina

Palitoy's Cantina was a cantina that did not serve droids. It employed an Aqualish bartender and had a Bith music band. At one point, C-3PO and R2-D2 had to wait outside while their Human companion entered the cantina.
metadata.title: Palitoy Cantina

metadata.content:
# Moko's Cantina

Moko's Cantina was located on the Crystal Web Station. It was owned by Moko Jax. The cantina itself was deemed a relief valve for the station and was a microcosm of the station itself: New Republic sympathizers drank alongside Imperials who eyed the aliens balefully. The main reason for the success of the bar was its owner, Moko Jax, who was a Force-sensitive that always seemed to be sensitive to others needs. In 4 ABY, the Luminous Bantha was found by Moko on the bench in one of the dark corners of the cantina. Though he did not know the actual value of the Bantha, he proudly displayed it on the counter behind the bar. He liked the way it looked there, and it provided him with a good conversation starter for his customers, although it only resided there for a standard week.
metadata.title: Moko's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Transis Corridor

The Transis Corridor was a cantina on the Errant Venture known for its popular ruby bliels.
metadata.title: Transis Corridor

metadata.content:
# Slag Pit

Slag Pit


General information

Location
Nar Shaddaa


[Source]

The Slag Pit was a cantina located on the Outer Rim Territories moon Nar Shaddaa. By the reign of the Galactic Empire, it had gained a reputation as one of the roughest bars in the galaxy. During the early days of the Imperial Era, the Latero pilot Greez Dritus and former Jedi Knight Cere Junda entered into an altercation with smugglers at the Slag Pit and were subsequently thrown out of the establishment. The two bonded over the incident and shared a drink of lum in a nearby alley.

In 14 BBY, Junda and Greez formed a crew with the Jedi Padawan Cal Kestis aboard the Stinger Mantis luxury yacht. Dritus recounted the event and cited it as the first time he had clicked with Junda. In the same conversation, Junda recounted her own memories of the event, citing it as one of the best nights of her life that she'd had in years.

In 3 ABY, the gambler Zana Gatta visited the Slag Pit a few days before visiting the casino cruiser Morenia.
metadata.title: Slag Pit

metadata.content:
# Hutt's Tail

Hutt's Tail was a cantina found in the center of the Red Sector of Nirama's public asteroid. It was a seedy place which made the roughest cantina on Tolea Biqua look nice. It had a circular bar in the middle staffed by the bartender Garnt, and had a perpetually hazy atmosphere. Gambling was popular within, with games being run at most of the tables, be it sabacc or other forms such as the chip-shuffling game run by Luco. Vel Pastar could typically be found seated in the deepest, darkest table in the cantina, with his daughter Kor doing recon for him.
metadata.title: Hutt's Tail

metadata.content:
# Methane Fix Cantina

Methane Fix Cantina


General information

Location
Mos Eisley, Tatooine


[Source]


The Methane Fix Cantina was a dining establishment in the spaceport of Mos Eisley on Tatooine. It was located on Dune Street, next door to the wreckage of the Dowager Queen.
metadata.title: Methane Fix Cantina

metadata.content:
# Underground

"Underground" was the primary cantina on Tilnes. It was located at the center of the tunnel networks of the mining moon, and it served as a gathering place for individuals from the different mining companies. The politics of the companies were forgotten here. "The Underground" was run by a Rodian named Maris Gen.
metadata.title: Underground

metadata.content:
# Bilbousa saloon - History[]

This saloon contained an outside terrace and an inside central bar with many tables and was guarded by four Gamorrean guards. An Ithorian and a Ran-D housekeeper droid worked at the cantina as bartenders.

Around 21 BBY, Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker and padawan Ahsoka Tano came to the cantina to seek out information regarding bounty hunter Rako Hardeen, interrogating the Ithorian bartender and getting in a fight with two Gamorrean guards.
metadata.title: Bilbousa saloon

Black Dust Tavern

Socorro

[Source]


The Black Dust Tavern was a cantina on Socorro.
metadata.title: Black Dust Tavern

metadata.content:
# The Cave

The Cave was a cantina situated in the floating city of Tolea Biqua on the planet Genarius, which offered patrons the opportunity to experience what life was like for a mynock. The cantina was located beneath Tolea Biqua and by utilizing both the city's rotation and artificial gravity generators, the patrons of the cantina were able to walk on the establishment's ceiling. Circa 31 BBY, the bounty hunter Melo Centris and some of her Devaronian associates visited The Cave.
metadata.title: The Cave

Theed Cantina

Cantina

The Wayfar Cantina was a cantina in the settlement Wayfar on the Outer Rim planet Tatooine.It was opened to the outside with two large entrances.

In 3 ABY, the cantina sold water for various prices depending on the type. Processed water cost three credit, fresh water cost six credits, and potable water sold for nine credits.
metadata.title: Wayfar Cantina

metadata.content:

Long Drink


General information

Morjanssik, Dac

The Long Drink was a cantina located in the city of Morjanssik on Dac. Kruluk worked there as a bartender. A fight occurred there during the Galactic Civil War between a group of Alliance to Restore the Republic operatives and Quarren thugs led by Logor working for the Galactic Empire.
metadata.title: Long Drink

Mynock's Haven

Galliwig's Cantina

Galliwig's Cantina was owned and run by the Human male known as Galliwig. The cantina included corner booths, and was known for playing music that offended the ears of some of the clientèle. During the Galactic Civil War, the Twi'lek free-trader Loh'khar the Finder used the cantina to conduct business transactions in, sitting in the same booth so that his regular customers could find him easily. In the cantina, Loh'khar acquired three Turazza eggs during a business deal; the eggs hatched into three sisters whom the Twi'lek named Rizzal, Vizzal, and Nizzal.
metadata.title: Galliwig's Cantina

Siltshift cantina

[Source]

The Siltshift cantina, also known as the Rodian's Revenge, was a cantina located in the settlement of Mos Ila on the planet of Tatooine. Owned by a Rodian named Regg, the cantina had two levels, as well as entertainment and vendors. An example of this was the Astromechalla band that played there during the Cold War between the Galactic Republic and the Sith Empire.
metadata.title: Siltshift cantina

metadata.content:
# Headache Bar

Headache Bar was a seedy cantina, located on level 20 of Nar Shaddaa. During the reign of the Galactic Empire, tempest spice was funneled through the bar by the clientele. Known for being poorly lit, something that suited the intoxicated an inebriate patrons well; it was rumored that around the clock, one of the apparently unconscious beings slumped at a table was actually dead.
metadata.title: Headache Bar

metadata.content:
# Pirates' Haul

The Pirates' Haul was a cantina located within the Coronet City on Corellia during the Galactic War. During the Battle of Corellia the resistance leader Nevis Kitt arranged the meeting there with Darmas Pollaran, whom he falsely believed to be a friend of the Galactic Republic.
metadata.title: Pirates' Haul

metadata.content:

The Twin Scales was a tavern in Karren, the capital city of the planet Antiquity.
metadata.title: Twin Scales

metadata.content:

The Giant Step


General information

Bar

The Strip, Vark Street, Takari, Iyuta

The Giant Step was a bar in the city of Takari, on the planet Iyuta. Located on The Strip, which was part of Vark Street, it catered to bored Imperial Marines. The imposter posing as the Alliance operative Chilla worked at The Giant Step.
metadata.title: The Giant Step

metadata.content:
# Sunset Cantina

Sunset Cantina was a seedy-looking cantina on the planet Coruscant. It was where former Jedi Jax Pavan and droid I-5YQ met with Black Sun associate Tuden Sal. They discussed Pavan's decision regarding Sal's plan to assassinate Emperor Palpatine.
metadata.title: Sunset Cantina

metadata.content:
# Paradise Cantina

Paradise Cantina


General information

Constructed
Prior to 40 ABY


Location
Bunar, Bador


[Source]

The Paradise Cantina was a rough and unkempt bar on Bador, one of Kuat's two moons. Located in a seedy neighborhood of Bunar, the cantina bore numerous scars from years of conflicts, and hosted an often dangerous clientele. In 40 ABY, the Mandalorian by the name of Jaing Skirata killed the crime boss Cherit at the Paradise Cantina, following a prolonged shootout. Not long after, Mand'alor Boba Fett and Mirta Gev traveled to the cantina in search of Skirata. Despite an initial conflict with the Paradise's bartender, the two were able to acquire a lead on Skirata's whereabouts and soon departed.
metadata.title: Paradise Cantina

metadata.content:
# Paradise Cantina - History[]

Constructed in the years prior to the outbreak of the Second Galactic Civil War, the Paradise Cantina saw numerous conflicts in and around the establishment throughout its existence. In 40 ABY, the bounty hunter Mirta Gev tracked stolen data she had been hired to recover to the Paradise Cantina. At the same time, the Mandalorian Jaing Skirata came to the Paradise in order to confront the local crime boss Cherit over the trafficking of Twi'lek women to Kuati nobles. Anticipating violence, Gev departed before a prolonged and damaging shootout broke out that left Cherit dead. Local security forces investigated the cantina in the aftermath.

Weeks later, Gev led her grandfather, the reigning Mand'alor Boba Fett, to the Paradise Cantina in search of Skirata. Upon entering, the two came into conflict with the Paradise's Kuati bartender, who resented the Mandalorian pair's appearance after the havoc Skirata previously wreaked. Though he attempted to retrieve an illegal, sawn-off Tenloss disruptor rifle from behind the bar, Fett and Gev successfully subdued the bartender and persuaded him to give up what information he had on Skirata. The Paradise's bartender pointed the pair toward the Tekshar Falls Casino in Kuat City, where the remnant of Cherit's gang resided. Fett and Gev subsequently left the cantina without further incident.
metadata.title: Paradise Cantina

metadata.content:
# Podracer's Retirement

Podracer's Retirement


General information

Location
Cloud City, Bespin, Outer Rim Territories


[Source]


The Podracer's Retirement was a popular cantina among mechanics and crew racing during the Galactic Civil War. It was located in Cloud City above the planet Bespin. Ol' Sav and Honest Grek were regular customers of the establishment.
metadata.title: Podracer's Retirement

metadata.content:
# The Fallen Warrior

The Fallen Warrior


General information

Location
Tel Bollin, Endregaad


[Source]

The Fallen Warrior was a cantina that was located in the city Tel Bollin, on the planet Endregaad. In 19 ABY, a viral outbreak spread among the inhabitants of Endregaad and the world was placed under quarantine by the Corporate Sector Authority. The world's Human residents blamed aliens for spreading the disease and many individuals of alien species took shelter inside The Fallen Warrior, which was built like a bunker and provided them with good protection. Several weeks later, the Jedi archivist Mander Zuma and the spacers Reen Irana and Eddey Be'ray traveled to the cantina in search of the Esral'sa'Nikto Orgamon.
metadata.title: The Fallen Warrior

metadata.content:

Slippery Slopes Cantina


General information

Location
Promenade, Nar Shaddaa


[Source]


The Slippery Slopes Cantina, also known as Headbutt Hari's cantina, was a cantina owned by Hari that was located in the Promenade shopping complex on Nar Shaddaa. Within the cantina was the Roughneck Room.
metadata.title: Slippery Slopes Cantina

metadata.content:
# Unidentified cantina (Coronet City)

Unidentified cantina


General information

Location
Coronet City, Corellia


[Source]


A cantina was located in Coronet City on Corellia. Several members of the Rebellion went to the cantina when they needed some rest and relaxation.
metadata.title: Unidentified cantina (Coronet City)

metadata.content:
# Spanner's

Spanner's


General information

Cularin

Spanner's was a racer bar that was located on the planet Cularin and operated during the waning years of the Galactic Republic.
metadata.title: Spanner's

metadata.content:
# Sarlacc and Loaded cantina

Sarlacc and Loaded Cantina was a cantina on Molavar during the Galactic War. It was reputed to be "the end of the line", "even by Outer Rim standards". Seamus Kaldo and his bodyguard Vhonu once met the infamous smuggler Nico Okarr at this cantina.
metadata.title: Sarlacc and Loaded cantina

vectors.title: The Dark Side of the Planet

The Dark Side of the Planet

The Dark Side of the Planet was an expensive cantina, regarded as the most famous nightspot in Nuba City, Nubia. The establishment featured skilled Twi'lek dancers and exotic offworld cuisine. It was owned by Tul Bulba.
metadata.title: The Dark Side of the Planet

metadata.content:
# Gak's

Gak's


General information

Location
Kwenn Space Station


[Source]

Gak's was a bar that operated on Kwenn Space Station during the Galactic Civil War. In 3 ABY a group of Rebel Alliance operatives ventured to the bar to rendezvous with the Bothan agent Corl'ya.
metadata.title: Gak's

metadata.content:
# Gak's - History[]

During the time of the Galactic Civil War, the Chadra-Fan bounty hunter Tutti Snibit often frequented Gak's. In 3 ABY a group of Rebel Alliance operatives assembled at Gak's to rendezvous with the Bothan Rebel agent Corl'ya. However, Cor'lya did not make an appearance at the bar and after the operatives had been waiting for an hour they left Gak's to return to their starship.
metadata.title: Gak's

metadata.content:
# Jokko Haning's Emporium

Jokko Haning's Emporium was a cantina located in Ackbar City on the planet Vandor-3. In 44 ABY, Wraith Squadron member Myri Antilles went to the bar undercover to gather information.
metadata.title: Jokko Haning's Emporium

metadata.content:
# Hard Heart Cantina - Layout[]

The main room was more or less a square, with the east wall containing the bar itself and a small stage located beyond that in the northeast corner. On the opposite side of the northwest wall were unisex/unispecies refreshers along with the manager's office. The north and south walls had exits, and an emergency exit was behind the bar.

Twenty tables filled the room, bolted to slides attached to the floor. Each table had low-backed stools that could be adjusted for height. As many as five tables in any row could be slid together to accommodate a large party. The stools could be moved but could also be electronically held in place by the bartender, in case the patrons got rowdy and considered using the stools as weapons. Blowers and vacuums that could be controlled by the bartender or servers were built into the ceiling and tabletops.
metadata.title: Hard Heart Cantina

metadata.content:
# Gak's - Description[]

Gak's was a seedy bar that operated on Kwenn Space Station, a shadowport in Mid Rim. The bar had a similar atmosphere to the Mos Eisley Cantina on the Outer Rim world of Tatooine.
metadata.title: Gak's

metadata.content:
# Paradise Cantina - Description[]

The Paradise Cantina was a run down bar located on Bador, one of two moons of the Core World Kuat, in a seedy neighborhood of the city of Bunar. Situated five kilometers south of a large public spaceport, the cantina was built with masonry construction, and possessed multiple doors. Over the bar's entrance was a sign that read "Welcome to the Paradise Cantina," followed by a warning that no helmets were allowed inside. By the time of the Second Galactic Civil War, the Paradise Cantina's outer facade had fallen into a state of scarred disrepair: blasterfire had left burnt blisters in the paint on the doors, the walls were pocked from the impact of multiple ballistic rounds, and an amount of blood had been left to pool and dry near the entrance.

The inside of the cantina featured tile flooring, and accommodations for patrons to sit while enjoying their drinks. The air smelled of stale ale, vomit, and oil. The Paradise Cantina possessed a long countertop bar, attended to by a barkeep, with shelves stocked with liquor and stacked glasses located behind it. Complimentary snacks were offered in dishes at the bar, including pickles that bore a physical resemblance to eyeballs; establishment policy required the purchase of a drink in order to partake of the bar snacks.
metadata.title: Paradise Cantina

Moenia Cantina

The Hard Heart Cantina was a cantina on the first Death Star run by the Twi'lek Memah Roothes. It was a popular spot for Imperial officers and NCOs assigned to duty on the Death Star.

The Hard Heart was officially designated the Midlevel Cantina on Deck 69 of Sector N-One. When Memah Roothes was hired to run the bar, she changed the name in tribute to her previous cantina on Coruscant, the Soft Heart Cantina. Her friend Rodo served as the cantina's bouncer. It was destroyed with the rest of the Death Star during the Battle of Yavin in 0 BBY.

The drinks served at the Hard Heart included:

Alarevi ale
Andoan ale
A Walk in the Phelopean Forest
generic and brand-name malt
Mon Calamari seaweed mash
Zabrak ferment
metadata.title: Hard Heart Cantina

metadata.content:
# Red Rancor

Red Rancor


General information

Coruscant


[Source]


The Red Rancor was a cantina on Coruscant. It had red lighting for the interior and had a bad reputation. In 19 ABY, Han Solo arranged for Luke Skywalker to have his bachelor party there.
metadata.title: Red Rancor

metadata.content:
# Spanner's - Description[]

Spanner's was located in the city Hedrett and was built out of a hull section from an old transport. It had two floors and outside, a hologram of a fusion wrench was projected over the front door.
metadata.title: Spanner's

metadata.content:
# Spanner's - History[]

After the Human mechanic Moorsey was injured in an industrial accident, his employers paid him off and he invested the money in Spanner's. He began to work there as a bartender and employed the Human Tara and the Zabrak Mykka as waiting staff. In about 31 BBY, the heroes of Cularin visited Spanner's.
metadata.title: Spanner's

Varath cantina

Diago Hixan's gang


[Source]

Tookreek's Cantina, also known as the Tookreek cantina, was a cantina located in Dreviad Outpost in the Jundland Wastes of the desert planet Tatooine during the Cold War between the Galactic Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire. It was named after its owner, the male Kadas'sa'Nikto Tookreek.
metadata.title: Tookreek's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Soft Heart Cantina

The Soft Heart Cantina was a cantina located in Grid 19 of the Southern Underground of Imperial Center. In the year 2 BBY, it burned down along with an entire city block, in a fire officially attributed to arson. While fire suppressors were supposed to protect the uninsured cantina, these mysteriously failed. The owner, Memah Roothes, and her bouncer, Rodo, agreed to transfer to another location owned by the Galactic Empire to work a new military cantina. Roothes named the cantina the Hard Heart Cantina, after her original cantina. The cantina was known to have membrosia.
metadata.title: Soft Heart Cantina

Bar


Location
Takari, Iyuta


[Source]

The Rusty Bucket was a bar in the city of Takari, on the planet Iyuta. The bar had a reputation as a business of ill repute. The Rebel agent Chilla was working as a bartender at The Rusty Bucket in 0 ABY when the Galactic Empire discovered her, wounding her which led to her death in the local sewers. The Rusty Bucket burned down shortly after. The Chadra-Fan bounty hunter Tutti Snibit was known to frequent The Rusty Bucket.
metadata.title: The Rusty Bucket

metadata.content:
# The Jungle Cantina

The Jungle Cantina


General information

Location
Ithorian Herdship Bazaar


[Source]

The Jungle Cantina was one of the finest cantinas aboard the Ithorian Herdship Bazaar. It was located in Isttu Village. The establishment was built around a central bar and had a number of tables. Three bartenders worked at the bar, while six waitresses were on hand to serve the tables. A secluded alcove was home to a four-piece band that played music ranging from Ithorian classics to chart-topping popular tunes. Nearly everyone who visited the Bazaar went to The Jungle Cantina and it was the hub of news and rumors for the ship.
metadata.title: The Jungle Cantina

The Last Resort was a cantina located in New Atraken City on the moon Trilos.
metadata.title: Last Resort

metadata.content:

Garang spaceport cantina


General information

Location
Garang spaceport, Dantooine


[Source]


The Garang spaceport cantina was a cantina located at the Garang spaceport on Dantooine. Rickard Lusoff and Calder Nettic once got drunk at the cantina and Rickard accused Calder of cheating him in a business deal. The Jedi Tooka was sent and resolved the conflict. Pazaak was a popular game at the cantina.
metadata.title: Garang spaceport cantina

metadata.content:

Cheapside Cantina


General information

Location
Bestine, Tatooine


[Source]

Cheapside Cantina, also known as the Bestine Cantina, was a cantina in the capital city of Bestine on the desert planet Tatooine.
metadata.title: Cheapside Cantina

metadata.content:
# Crosstown Bar

The Crosstown Bar, also known as Crosstown, was a tavern that located on the planet Cularin. It operated during the waning years of the Galactic Republic.
metadata.title: Crosstown Bar

metadata.content:
# Fische's Pub

Fische's Pub


General information

Location
Point Nadir


[Source]

Fische's Pub was a cantina located in the Slips in Point Nadir. It was named after the founder of Point Nadir, Salovan Fische and was a popular spot for smugglers, pirates, and black marketers. It often had live musical entertainment.
metadata.title: Fische's Pub

metadata.content:
# Space Monkey Café - History[]

By about 32 BBY, the Sullustan Chelsey Grimes had became the café's manager. Adran Blake worked there as a cook, while the Human Maureen worked at the bar. Selima DeWitt, the daughter of the Baron Administrator of Bayonard, was a regular patron of the café. When she went missing, the heroes of Cularin were hired to find her, and they visited the café to see if they could find any clues about what had happened to her. While there, they spoke to Narask and Tyburn Welles, two associates of DeWitt.
metadata.title: Space Monkey Café

metadata.content:
# The Hutt's Last Laugh

The Hutt's Last Laugh


General information

Location
Blinders district, Sahl-Evin, Jenenma


[Source]

The Hutt's Last Laugh was a cantina that was located in the Blinders district of the city Sahl-Evin, on the planet Jenenma. The Zabrak Orth Maag worked in the Last Laugh as a bartender and the majority of the establishment's patrons were Duros. At some point during galactic history, a group of agents visited The Hutt's Last Laugh while they were tracking down a stolen starship that had been taken to the Blinders district. The Gamorrean Tarkil Hroka spilt his drink on one of the agents and he attempted to engage in a fight with the individual.
metadata.title: The Hutt's Last Laugh

metadata.content:
# Nia Adea - History[]

At one point in her travels Nia visited the Thirsty Bantha, a Mos Entha cantina owned and operated by her old Besalisk friend Robb. When she arrived she witnessed Robb being threatened and physically assaulted by the Devaronian loan shark Varak'Cha, who gave Robb fifteen days to get back the credits he borrowed to keep the cantina in business. Nia offered to help him raise the money needed.

The friends implemented a division of labor: Robb would prepare the drinks, while Adea waited the tables. Additionally, Adea entrusted Robb with her recipe for flavor syrup, intended to make beverages taste better. Eventually, Adea's assistance turned things around financially for Thirsty Bantha and Robb was able to pay off his debts. With the cantina back on its feet, Adea left to pursue other interests.
metadata.title: Nia Adea

metadata.content:
# Space Monkey Café

The Space Monkey Café was a bar in the city of Bayonard, on the planet Cularin. It operated during the waning years of the Galactic Republic.
metadata.title: Space Monkey Café

metadata.content:
# Unidentified Mos Eisley cantina

Unidentified Mos Eisley cantina


General information

Location
Mos Eisley, Tatooine


[Source]

A sleazy cantina operated business in the Mos Eisley spaceport on the planet Tatooine by 3.5 ABY. Rebel Alliance members Princess Leia Organa and Lando Calrissian rendezvoused there once in that year.
metadata.title: Unidentified Mos Eisley cantina

metadata.content:
# Paradise (cantina) - History[]

Jool had been obtaining more profits thanks to the scarcity of legal supplies during the Second Imperial Civil War, and had decided to expand her business, starting on Zeltros. A number of attractive native Zeltron males and females became frequent patrons of the cantina, as did Jool herself.

True to its name, the cantina was constructed as a lush, oasis-like "paradise," complete with lush landscaping, an indoor/outdoor bar, and a poolside cabana and lounge area; the large natural pool was always kept full and pristine by the giant, 100-foot-tall waterfalls which delivered a constant flow of water into the oasis. The daring and physically fit Zeltrons, as well as a number of other species, would occasionally dive from the top of the falls into the pool below, a feat which was liable to become somewhat competitive, especially between males; however, the multiple-story-high dive was still considered a very risky pastime, especially for the average Human, to attempt. considered too. Nevertheless, Cade Skywalker and Jariah Syn did just that, with Cade using the Force to slow their fall and lessen their impact upon the water's surface; Skywalker later remarked that his Master, Wolf Sazen, would kill him if he saw him using the Force for fun or for selfish thrill-seeking.

The pirate Rav arrived at Paradise with two of his henchmen as Skywalker, Syn and crew were partying. Queen Jool, who was also present, had just told Cade that although she loved him, his rowdiness in her cantina was becoming a liability and she needed him to keep the potential damages to a minimum. He obliged, just as he pushed one of Rav's sidekicks off the waterfall and struck the other in the neck in the pool. Upon seeing this, Rav offered Cade and his crew a mission on Wayland for one million credits.
metadata.title: Paradise (cantina)

metadata.content:
# Sangorn's Net

Sangorn's Net was a bar that operated during the time of the Galactic Civil War and was popular with criminals. The Alliance Intelligence agent Fulkrehm Protial once went on an undercover mission there, in disguise as a drunk.
metadata.title: Sangorn's Net

The Thorip Norr was a cantina located in the Lola Curich Starport, on the world of Lianna. It was owned and operated by the Gamorrean Ithmir and catered to mostly non-human spacers.
metadata.title: Thorip Norr

metadata.content:
# Club Ufora

Club Ufora


General information

Location
Red Light Sector, Nar Shaddaa


[Source]

Club Ufora was a cantina and club located in the sprawling city moon of Nar Shaddaa. Located in the Red Light Sector of Nar Shaddaa's underground, Club Ufora was one of the seedier establishments on the moon. In the year 3643 BBY, a Republic-allied individual discovered that the back area of Club Ufora had several slave crates. After investigating further, the hero found out that the Republic's Lieutenant Rale was being held captive. He informed the hero that several other officers had been taken captive as well. He thought that it was possible that the other captive officers could have been held in the Quarantine Zone. His supposition proved right, and Club Ufora's operation was shut down.
metadata.title: Club Ufora

metadata.content:

Maggot's Cantina


General information

Location
Anzat Spaceport


[Source]

Maggot's Cantina was a drinking and dining establishment on Anzat.

The cantina was a gathering place for spacers and pilots who came to the Anzat Spaceport to refuel or for business issues. The Jedi Aayla Secura visited the cantina on a mission; the Houk Gort was present at the time.
metadata.title: Maggot's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Sophouse

The Sophouse was a cantina on Cularin. Toward the end of the Clone Wars, two individuals discussed how they believed the Jedi Order was dying out in the galaxy.
metadata.title: Sophouse

metadata.content:

In the Red


General information

Bonadan

In the Red was a cantina located on Bonadan. During the Yuuzhan Vong War, Uldir Lochett and his crew encountered Klin-Fa Gi there while waiting for their ship to be repaired.
metadata.title: In the Red

The Golden Gorg Cantina was a cantina located within the Crimson Axe in the planet Socorro. It was owned by Rav, a Feeorin pirate.

Marqo's

D'larah

Cradjius LucernG'uotr Network


[Source]

Marqo's was a renowned eatery in D'larah, on the planet Demophon. It was owned by Cradjius Lucern, who took over after its founder fled before the impending Demophon system supernova. Lucern decided to capitalize on Marqo's reputation as a luxurious restaurant, keeping the name as he transformed it into a dark and moody gambling hall and cantina. Many of the people of D'larah saw Marqo's as a chance for escape, hoping to win enough gambling to buy passage off world.
metadata.title: Marqo's

The Byss Bistro, also known as the Spacer's Bistro, was a cantina on Byss, the reborn Emperor's throneworld.

Mother Lode Cantina

Location
Work Zone sector, Prak City, Prakith


[Source]


The Mother Lode Cantina was a cantina in the Work Zone sector of the planet Prakith's capital city, Prak City. It was run by a reclusive female Bothan and was habituated by the city's construction workers and miners, notably the old owner of the Geddis mine, Myrum Geddis.
metadata.title: Mother Lode Cantina

metadata.content:
# Homestar

Homestar was a cantina located on Treasure Ship Row on Corellia. Its unremarkable exterior hid an expansive interior, complete with dancers and a live band. Jedi Knights Aayla Secura and Ylenic It'kla got into a scuffle with three Gotals here while searching for Ratri Tane.
metadata.title: Homestar

metadata.title: Need's Mead

# Happy Bergruutfa Cantina

The Happy Bergruutfa Cantina was planet-based cantina. A group of Rebels talked with a spaceport technician about the cantina.
metadata.title: Happy Bergruutfa Cantina

# Plastoid Pitt

The Plastoid Pitt was a cantina in Xucphra City on Thyferra. Many beings who entered the cantina were abducted, and later sold as slaves.
metadata.title: Plastoid Pitt

The Drunken Bantha was a cantina on Ord Mantell.
metadata.title: The Drunken Bantha

Unidentified bar (Outsider Citadel)

A cantina was located in the Outsider Citadel on the planet Cerea. It was often frequented by smugglers. Seeking information on who was smuggling swoop bikes into the planet, Ki-Adi-Mundi went there looking for his friend Ydde and found him drinking there. An Aurebesh sign over the entrance said "BAR".

metadata.content:
# Crosstown Bar - History[]

Following the Battle of Kromus during the Clone Wars, a number of people gathered in the Crosstown Bar to watch a broadcast on the tavern's holoprojector, where the Galactic Senate issued a statement of regret about the large-scale loss of life during the battle.
metadata.title: Crosstown Bar

categories: Articles that are known by a nickname
metadata.content:
# Groshik's cantina

Groshik's Cantina was located on the planet Apatros. It was owned by the Neimoidian Groshik, who also served as the bartender. It was a popular hangout for cortosis miners. The bar was made to look like it was three stories high, when in reality the top two levels were colored glass made to give an illusion of importance. It contained sabacc tables. A portion of the cantina's profits were given to ORO as required by the company which dominated Apatros. The young miner Dessel, who would later become Darth Bane, played sabacc here, and once won a small fortune from a Republic ensign, nearly starting a riot.
metadata.title: Groshik's cantina

metadata.content:
# Locru's Central Saloon

Locru's Central Saloon


General information

Location
Tun Aduban, Aduba-3


[Source]

Locru's Central Saloon was a cantina near the center of Tun Aduban on Aduba-3. It was founded by Locru. It also served as an inn, charging twelve credits a night.

Frequent customers included Warto and Azoora.

It was here that Han Solo and Chewbacca recruited spacers to fight Serji-X Arrogantus, forming the Eight for Aduba-3.

If approached from the direction of Spacer's Hill, it was the third structure to the left past the Town Circle.

A set of stairs led up from the bar to the lobby, adjacent to which were bedrooms where customers could stay.
metadata.title: Locru's Central Saloon

Ta's Roost

metadata.title: Ta's Roost

metadata.content:
# Trail's End

The Trail's End was a tavern in the city of Besia Osurne on the planet Sedesia. It was favored by breedtash ranchers and meat packers.
metadata.title: Trail's End

metadata.content:
# Space Monkey Café - Description[]

The café consisted of a glass and duracrete lounge located on top of a three-story tower. Beneath it were kitchens, storage rooms and rooms that were available for rent. It had a high turnover of staff and had a resident band, the Space Monkeys, who gave regular performances.
metadata.title: Space Monkey Café

metadata.content:
# Jungle Lust

The Jungle Lust was a cantina in the domed city of Plawal where the town boss ran card games. It featured a male Twi'lek and female Gamorrean dancer, as well as old Framjem Spathen music holos. Sadie was the bartender.
metadata.title: Jungle Lust

metadata.content:
# Event Horizon (Duro)

The Event Horizon was a cantina buried deep within the Rrudobar orbital city over the planet Duro, established by Clawfish, a Quarren criminal. It was well-known among smugglers, gunrunners, and outlaw techs working the Corellian Trade Spine as a source of illicit information or a good brawl.

The cantina's most distinguishing feature was its dual-environment layout; half was reserved as a typical (if humid) cantina for terrestrial patrons, while the other half contained spas and wading pools for aquatic species. The two halves were divided by the bar, which faced in both directions. There was a concealed escape tunnel leading to the street, which exited from the bar and a false crate in the storage area.

Placards on the walls warned Neimoidians, droids, and repo agents to stay away.
metadata.title: Event Horizon (Duro)

metadata.content:
# Blasted Asteroid (the Wheel) - History[]

The establishment was in business during the Galactic Civil War, at which time the cantina's best bouncer and bartender was a muscular Human named Ceoloe, who was normally able to break up any fights. In such fights, Ceoloe particularly looked to protect Waroon Dak, a Corellian infochant who paid the bouncer a small finder's fee to regularly use a table by the bar for his work, as well as for tips as to potential sources of information.
metadata.title: Blasted Asteroid (the Wheel)

metadata.content:
# Downside (cantina)

Downside was a cantina on the moon Trilos, located in New Atraken City.
metadata.title: Downside (cantina)

metadata.content:
# Fainar's Cantina

Fainar's Cantina


General information

Type
Cantina


Location
Abregado-rae


[Source]

Fainar's Cantina was a cantina on the planet Abregado-rae during the Cold War and Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire. Owned by the Force-sensitive Fainar, the cantina was renowned as one of the safest underworld retreats in the galaxy due to the planet's government's propensity for taking bribes and Fainar's Force abilities that let her detect any Jedi or Sith who were attempting to listen in on her patrons' thoughts. The cantina also boasted a significant amount of electronic countermeasures in order to ensure its customers' complete privacy.
metadata.title: Fainar's Cantina

metadata.content:
# Telkur Station Cantina

The Telkur Station Cantina was a seedy pirate cantina on the Telkur Station.
metadata.title: Telkur Station Cantina

metadata.content:
# Botcha's

Botcha's


General information

Location
Druckenwell


[Source]

Botcha's was a bar that operated on the planet Druckenwell during the latter years of the Galactic Republic. The establishment was often frequented by the Besalisk infochant Fenix. Around 21 BBY, a group of freelance agents searching for the stolen freighter First Light ventured to Botcha's to seek to information on the vessel's whereabouts from Fenix.
metadata.title: Botcha's

metadata.content:
# Building 49-A - Description[]

Building 49-A was the only cantina on Almas. It was a two-story pre-fabricated unit that was located north of the planet's spaceport. Many of its patrons were farmers, such as the Trandoshan Kressis.
metadata.title: Building 49-A

metadata.content:
# Telkur Station Cantina - Description[]

The cantina was a place illuminated by dim blue lightning and filled with the sweet taint of Rekka smoke hanging in the air. The discreet entrance was half-concealed somewhere along the establishment's eight walls. The room's only ceiling was a disorganized web of ventilation ducts.

The place featured a filthy bar whose Hapan barkeepers handed out datapads with drink recipes featuring beverages like the Red Cloud and the flat-tasting Gizer Ale, which were both served in mugs to guests.

The cantina's clients were exclusively Human and Near-Human who sat clustered in groups of three or four around corroded, rust-stained durasteel tables. The male patrons were handsome but scroungy looking with three-day beards, whereas the Hapan women dressed to look tough and available. The pirate station used to be a prominent hotspot for outlawed ships to pick up supplies because the place was not on the radar of Hapan Security.

Although weapons were permitted, droids had to stay outside. The cantina also refrained from using any bartending or surveillance droids for business.
metadata.title: Telkur Station Cantina

metadata.content:
# Wages of Phy'r

The Wages of Phy'r was a cantina on the planet Krann. It was located on a shopping concourse where an Ugor criminal offered spice for sale, including the dangerous eldratz. The bar's primary clientele were miners and shopworkers. Table service was offered by droids.
metadata.title: Wages of Phy'r

metadata.content:
# Green Mist

Green Mist


General information

Location
Lamuir IV


[Source]


The Green Mist was a tavern located near the primary spaceport on the planet of Lamuir IV in the Tapani sector. The Herglic Gotspar tended the bar at the establishment.
metadata.title: Green Mist

metadata.content:
# Slag Pit

The Slag Pit was a cantina on Nar Shaddaa in the Corellian Sector and owned by Odrell Vorbaal. Along with the Meltdown Café and The Burning Deck, it was one of the moon's three most popular bounty hunter hangouts.
metadata.title: Slag Pit

metadata.content:
# Thirsty Bantha - Inhabitants[]

Before Nia Adea's arrival, the cantina's only employee was Robb. The low popularity of Thirsty Bantha meant that it was only frequented by Jawas at first, but thanks to Adea's makeover, several other groups of patrons began frequenting the establishment: local moisture farmers, Gamorreans, Twi'lek smugglers, Rodian bounty hunters, and even Imperial stormtroopers. Regular customers included Wunda, Olaf, Tikkit, Mogrugg, Jac'Ril, Neelir, and Dave.
metadata.title: Thirsty Bantha

metadata.content:
# Unidentified Dreshdae cantina

Unidentified Dreshdae cantina


General information

Location
Dreshdae, Korriban


[Source]


A cantina in Dreshdae, situated on the planet Korriban, was visited by the Jedi Duron Qel-Droma in his search for Terentateks during the Great Hunt.
metadata.title: Unidentified Dreshdae cantina

metadata.content:
# Thirsty Bantha - Description[]

Located in a back alley near the center of the city Mos Entha on Tatooine, Thirsty Bantha was named for the non-sentient bantha creature. It was a relatively small cantina, and the building itself was built in a style resembling other Mos Enthan structures. It consisted chiefly of two rooms, separated by a short flight of stairs. The outermost room was occupied by the entrance area, where customers waited in line to be seated, and which also held the bar. The inner room contained all the establishment's tables and a stage for musical acts.

The walls and floor of the cantina were made from a brown stone, and were utterly unembellished. Drinks of several colors were served in Thirsty Bantha: green, purple, blue, orange, and yellow. Although initially somewhat plain and moderately decorated, the cantina received a number of upgrades over time. Customer capacity was increased from two tables to six when Nia Adea began supervision of the cantina, and a number of aesthetic aids and entertainment products were installed to increase customer satisfaction. Two droids were purchased to help mix drinks. With their aid, at least two new drink varieties were added to the cantina's repertoire.
metadata.title: Thirsty Bantha

metadata.content:
# Building 49-A

Building 49-A was a cantina that was located on the planet Almas.
metadata.title: Building 49-A

metadata.content:
# Hedrett Observation Lounge

Hedrett Observation Lounge was a cantina located in Hedrett on Cularin that operated during the time of the Clone Wars.
metadata.title: Hedrett Observation Lounge

metadata.content:
# Gundark's Cantina

Gundark's Cantina was a popular cantina located on Sel Zonn Station. Run by a man called "Gundark" Saff, its many secluded booths proved useful for those who wished to discuss their business in private.
metadata.title: Gundark's Cantina
